Choices:  A: determination B: upper hand C: superior D: higher position E: skill<n><n>### Response:		The right answer is "C: superior"<n><n>### InputThe number of players playing chess with 4 players is  \(4*4\);  with 5 players  \(5*5\); with 6 players  \(6*6\); with 7 players  \(7*7\); and so on.  The sum of 1 \(+ 2 + 3 +... + k - 1\) is called the Fibonacci sequence.  The first two numbers of this sequence are 0 and 1, and all the other numbers are the sum of the precedent two.  What is the sum of all the numbers in this sequence that have 50 digits?<n><n>### ResponseThe right answer is "7128580"<n><n>### InstructionsFind the difference of the inputs by subtracting the second column  \(N\) from the first column \(M\).  Write the answer in a blank at the end of a column.  The next three inputs have numbers, so make sure you fill that blank before moving onto the next three inputs.<n><n>### InputsFor example:  Input 1 \(6\) and Input 2 \(8\)<n><n>### ResponseInput number 1:  \(6 - 8 = -2\)<n><n>### InputFor example:  Input \(5 + 4\) and Input \(8 - 4\)<n><n>### InstuctionsFind the difference of two numbers.  Choose two digits from the original number (eight digits).  Use these digits to write a number in column \(A\).  Then, subtract these two numbers from the input number.  Repeat this until the last column has the end value.<n><n>### ResponseFor example: Column A  \(12345567\),  Column B  `17\)<n><n>### SolutionFor example: Column A \(12342197\),  Column A  \(167\)<n><n>## Solution<n><n>Give the first two columns  one-digit numbers.  The third column  has the numbers for the digits 2, 3, and 4.  The 4th column has the 4th to the 9th.<n><n>Solution:<n><n>| Column | 2 3 4                     | 2 3                    | 3

If he always rode in the same sleeper car, can you determine all the stops he made?<n><n>### Response B:no you cannot determine each stop a train will make, but you can determine all the stops the train made because the train only stopped at preplanned stations the man will arrive at a different station each morning and no longer in the same station each evening meaning the train had to stopped at a different location.<n><n>###Input C:Three women were each on time for an appointment with their doctor. However, they were not allowed in the waiting room since they were late by an hour, 14 hours, and 16 hours for the three days of doctor's office appointments. The doctor's office hours are Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday from 11:59am to 3pm. Write a program that prints the three hours they could enter the waiting room on time.<n><n>###Response C:This can be answered by using a modulo function I recommend mod by 3 but if it happens to be more than 1 then do the mod by 3 times by the difference of 1.<n><n>Example<n><n>Women 1 arrives on time at 1:00<n>Women 2 arrives on time at2:00<n>Woman 3 arrives on time at3:00<n>So the three women who are on time would be 1:00, 2:00, or 3:00<n><n>###Input D:A man traveled 1 mile from his house to work. The next day he traveled 20 miles more to his work. If he also drove 5 miles more on his way back to home, how many miles was his total travel?<n><n>###Response D:The answer is 27 miles<n><n>Input:1 mile + 20 mile + 5 miles = 27 miles<n>

One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. They work for four hours and are then joined by 6 other people who also work at the same rate. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>Input: Jodi starts off walking 1 mile a day for 6 days a week.  On the second week, she walks 2 miles a day, 6 days a week.  On the third week, she walks 3 miles a day, 6 days a week. Finally on the fourth week, she walks 4 miles a day, 6 days a week.  How many miles has she walked in 4 weeks?<n>Answer: 60<n><n>Input: A club is going to get additional members so that they will have 5 more than twice their current number of their members. If the club has 10 members now, how many additional members do they need?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>### Input:If people listen, they can understand each other better.  If they understand each other, they can do what? Choices:  A: pay bills B: swap bodies C: learn from each other D: believe in god E: talk to each other<n><n>### Response:		E<n><n>### Instructor Explanation:<n>This is the last one<n>"Answers:", "Answer:", "Answer: 1",<n>"Answer: 2", "Answer: 3",<n>"Answer:", "Answer:"

How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>Input: Jodi starts off walking 1 mile a day for 6 days a week.  On the second week, she walks 2 miles a day, 6 days a week.  On the third week, she walks 3 miles a day, 6 days a week. Finally on the fourth week, she walks 4 miles a day, 6 days a week.  How many miles has she walked in 4 weeks?<n>Answer: 60<n><n>Input: A club is going to get additional members so that they will have 5 more than twice their current number of their members. If the club has 10 members now, how many additional members do they need?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>### Input:If I have a forgiving attitude toward someone, what do they receive? Choices:  A: building B: hallway C: table D: exchange E: office<n><n>### Response:		Traders work in a building (B) or hallway (A) or table (E), but not an office (D).<n><n>### Answer:D<n><n>### Inputs:Cody’s car gets 32 miles per gallon at 65 miles per hour and on average costs 100 cents a gallon. Lizzie’s car gets 26 miles per gallon at the same speeds and on average costs 85 cents a gallon? Choices:  C: 1226 miles B: 1026 miles D: 850 miles E: 45 miles<n><n>### Response :Lizzie’s car drives more miles per hour in the same time?<n><n>### Answer :C<n><n>### Input :Gene needs to buy his birthday cake online, but some people think that the online store is spam and won’t order from the store. If Gene’s friends were equally divided into two groups where 42% thought the cake store was spam and 58% were not inclined to buy from online cake stores, what percent of his friends bought from Gene’s store? Choices: A: 22% B: 29% C: 49% D: 61% E: 67%<n><n>### Response::Gene’s friends bought from the store.<n><n>### Answer.:D<n><n>### Question:Helen has $900 in her checking account and $200 in her savings account. How many dollars in total does she have? Choices: A B: 1100 dollars C: 900 dollars D: 1020 dollars E: 720 dollars<n><n>### Response.:Dollars Helen has 1020<n><n>### Answer:)D<n><n>### Instructions:Jim is looking for a job in a company and they need someone to type a certain number of words per minute.  He takes a typing test and hits the keyboard 1000 times for 5 minutes.  In that time he types 120 words. (His average typing rate is 120 words/minute). If he worked for 6 hours, 200 words would be typed in 6 hours.

They work for four hours and are then joined by 6 other people who also work at the same rate. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>Input: Jodi starts off walking 1 mile a day for 6 days a week.  On the second week, she walks 2 miles a day, 6 days a week.  On the third week, she walks 3 miles a day, 6 days a week. Finally on the fourth week, she walks 4 miles a day, 6 days a week.  How many miles has she walked in 4 weeks?<n>Answer: 60<n><n>Input: A club is going to get additional members so that they will have 5 more than twice their current number of their members. If the club has 10 members now, how many additional members do they need?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>### Input:Rumors of roving bands of monsters killing people could lead to what? Read the digits in the given order, from left to right, to deduce the original number.<n><n>### Response 1:<n>Input 1:69136<n>Rotation of 2(16 to get as: 147) 2(15 to get as:247) 20<n>69136=691<n><n>### Demmornation 1:<n><n>### Input.<n><n>```<n>You are working on a jigsaw puzzle and you have 14 pieces to complete the edge of the puzzle. How many pieces do you need to complete the inner puzzle?<n>```<n><n>### Response.<n><n>```<n>240<n>```<n><n>## Solution 2<n><n><n>### Input one:<n>In each of these questions is a number written base 16 which has been written in base 2 and is in the format p2.n where the number p has been rounded down. Read the digits in a given order, from leftto-right, to determine the number from which the 0 has been deducted.<n><n>### Resonse two: <n><n>### Input three<n><n>Each is a number written in decimal which has been written as base 2. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>Input: Jodi starts off walking 1 mile a day for 6 days a week.  On the second week, she walks 2 miles a day, 6 days a week.  On the third week, she walks 3 miles a day, 6 days a week. Finally on the fourth week, she walks 4 miles a day, 6 days a week.  How many miles has she walked in 4 weeks?<n>Answer: 60<n><n>Input: A club is going to get additional members so that they will have 5 more than twice their current number of their members. Choices:  A: sum B: likeness C: alike D: sameness E: similarity<n><n>### Response:		The question that must be answered is which options are alike to each other.  I would get rid of letters D and E, because each letter does not match in any way but similarity, and it would be pointless to continue reading the instructions after selecting them.  I would also get rid of letter C, because it does not match with letter A in anyway and you would have nothing to compare in order to say that they are alike.  You must compare two different letters to say that they are either alike or unalike.  After that, you can choose C over letter A, because letter A and letter B are alike and the choices can be compared.  There could also be other letters that match with each other too.<n><n>### Input and Response:<n><n>2. A: sum<n><n>3. B: likeness<n><n>In this context, the only letters that match in this sentence/question are E and F.  If the two letters were to be compared with each other again, you would get A: Likeness & B: Likeness, and you would be correct if you chose A.<n><n>4. C: alike<n><n>You would still need to get rid of the letters A, D, and E in this next example, because they do not match up with each other based on the same context.<n><n>5. D: sameness<n><n>6. E: similarity<n><n>7. F: alike<n><n><n>### Input & Response:<n><n>> A. B. C. D. E.<n><n>Alien Drug Smuggling Alien Drugs Alien Aliens Alien<n><n>I did not include the question again because you would have no way to compare the rest of the letters to any other letter in this context.  You would need to get rid of letters A and E when selecting the other options.<n><n>### Output:What will be the correct answers to these questions? Choices:  1. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>Input: Jodi starts off walking 1 mile a day for 6 days a week.  On the second week, she walks 2 miles a day, 6 days a week.  On the third week, she walks 3 miles a day, 6 days a week. Finally on the fourth week, she walks 4 miles a day, 6 days a week.  How many miles has she walked in 4 weeks?<n>Answer: 60<n><n>Input: A club is going to get additional members so that they will have 5 more than twice their current number of their members. If the club has 10 members now, how many additional members do they need?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>### Input:What does exercising immediately lead to? Choices:  A: relaxation B: exhaustion C: energetic D: become stronger E: use energy<n><n>### Response:		Answer: E<n><n>### Instructions:Write a recursive solution to implement the below task.<n><n>### Task:In the game of darts, a dart board is a rectangle divided into 20 numbered segments.  Each segment has a value. If you hit a segment’s value on your throw, you score points.  If you hit it with a double or a triple, you score more points.  Given your throw, determine the number of points you score in that segment.  This function is written in C and called from the main.<n><n>### Function:  <n>char main(void)<n>{<n>    char throw[10];<n>    char *p;<n>    int scores;<n>        <n>    do {<n>        printf("Enter your throw: ");<n>        scanf("%s", throw);<n>    } while (strlen(throw)!= 10);<n>    <n><n>    printf("The value of the segment you’ve hit is %.2f. You win %.2f from this segment.\n\n", <n>       scores, (double)(scores * 1.5));<n><n>    strcpy(throw+1, throw+strlen(throw));<n>    strcat(throw, throw+strlen("000"));<n>    p=throw+strlen(throw)-2;<n>    <n>    while(*p==0) p++;<n>    if(*p=='+') *p='.';<n>    while(*p<='8') *p++;<n><n>    printf("#  Scores at %s of %d:\n", throw, atoi(throw));<n>    //      printf("#  Scores and winnings at #%s of %d:\t", throw, scorep);<n>    for (int i=1; i<=atoi(throw); ++i) <n>        printf("# %d, score %d wins %f\n", i, scores[i-1], <n>           (double)(scores[i-1] *.5));<n>    printf("\n\n\n\n");}<n><n>

He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. They work for four hours and are then joined by 6 other people who also work at the same rate. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>Input: Jodi starts off walking 1 mile a day for 6 days a week.  On the second week, she walks 2 miles a day, 6 days a week.  On the third week, she walks 3 miles a day, 6 days a week. Finally on the fourth week, she walks 4 miles a day, 6 days a week.  How many miles has she walked in 4 weeks?<n>Answer: 60<n><n>Input: A club is going to get additional members so that they will have 5 more than twice their current number of their members. If the club has 10 members now, how many additional members do they need?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>### Input:A small dog is lost in New England, where would it likely be found? Choices:  A: own home B: old england C: new hampshire D: coffin E: denmark<n><n>### Response:		E<n><n>### Input:"It has been proven that bones actually heal faster during the summer."How would you respond to this claim?<n><n>### Response:"This is a common misconception, that is true. It has not been proven to have any affect on bones in the summer time."<n>

If it is more than $5 above, then she will sell the vase at a wholesale price of 90% of cost.  How much may she net on her sale, assuming the sale is either a net gain or net loss by $5?<n><n>Input:  A<n>Answer:<n>If the sale is between $30 and $35 net profit is $5<n><n>Input:<n>Answer: 95<n><n>Input:  D<n>Answer:<n>A<n><n>Input:<n>If the sale price is between $30-$40 net profit is $5.  If it is between $40-$50 then net profit is $10<n>If it is between $50-$60 then the net profit is $15<n>If it is between 60 and 70 then the net profit would be $20<n><n>Input:<n>A<n><n>Answer: 145<n><n>##<n>

What is the probability he wrote a book in at most 7 years?<n><n>Answer: 0:83333...<n><n>### Instuct:Answer the following  multiple choice question.<n>Input : A person is asked 10 multiple choice questions 101-1010 with 10 options per each question. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>Input: Jodi starts off walking 1 mile a day for 6 days a week.  On the second week, she walks 2 miles a day, 6 days a week.  On the third week, she walks 3 miles a day, 6 days a week. Finally on the fourth week, she walks 4 miles a day, 6 days a week.  How many miles has she walked in 4 weeks?<n>Answer: 60<n><n>Input: A club is going to get additional members so that they will have 5 more than twice their current number of their members. If the club has 10 members now, how many additional members do they need?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>### Input:What home entertainment equipment requires cable? Choices:  A: radio shack B: substation C: cabinet D: television E: desk<n><n>### Response:		Television or computer (C and E)<n><n>Output:<n><n>1) (A,C)<n><n>2) (C,E)<n><n>3) (E)<n><n>Answer: Television<n><n>### Input<n><n>Ezra is going on a 3 week backpacking trip to the Yukon.  He will carry 50 pounds of food for each of the 3 weeks, weighing in at 150 pounds total.  He will also bring two tents, which together weigh 20 pounds, and three sleeping bags, which weigh 25 pounds each.  The tents and sleeping bags add up to a combined weight of 60 pounds.  How many pounds of food should Ezra bring to eat for the entire trip?<n><n>(a) 200 pounds<n><n>(b) 130 pounds<n><n>(c) 100 pounds<n><n>Answer: This is a weight problem.<n><n>1a 60 + 150 = 210<n>2a 60 + x + 3x = 220<n><n>Subtract 220 - 210 = 10 to get:<n><n>2b 60 + 2 + 4x = 150<n><n>Divide by 4:<n><n>2c 60 + 4 + 20 + (20/4) = 60/4 + 20% = 60/2 + 1/10 = 30 + 1/1 + 1/5 = 30 + (1/5)/10 = 3 + 1/50 = 3.1/50 =.4 +.4/5 = 8/50 =.8/5.<n><n>Solve:<n><n>c18.8 * 5<n><n>c24 pounds<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Find each of the following sets of numbers in arithmetic sequence and solve each equation.<n><n>Input: 10,6,4,2,2,4<n><n>10 * 10/2- (6+4)/2- (2+2)/2- (4+2)/2 = 4<n><n>Answer: 3<n><n>### Instructuon:

One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. They work for four hours and are then joined by 6 other people who also work at the same rate. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>Input: Jodi starts off walking 1 mile a day for 6 days a week.  On the second week, she walks 2 miles a day, 6 days a week.  On the third week, she walks 3 miles a day, 6 days a week. Finally on the fourth week, she walks 4 miles a day, 6 days a week.  How many miles has she walked in 4 weeks?<n>Answer: 60<n><n>Input: A club is going to get additional members so that they will have 5 more than twice their current number of their members. If the club has 10 members now, how many additional members do they need?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>### Input:What would a camper need to do before he or she can start cooking food? Choices:  A: make breakfast B: go hiking C: pack or bag D: light fire E: grab a match<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### <n>

She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>Input: Jodi starts off walking 1 mile a day for 6 days a week.  On the second week, she walks 2 miles a day, 6 days a week.  On the third week, she walks 3 miles a day, 6 days a week. Finally on the fourth week, she walks 4 miles a day, 6 days a week.  How many miles has she walked in 4 weeks?<n>Answer: 60<n><n>Input: A club is going to get additional members so that they will have 5 more than twice their current number of their members. If the club has 10 members now, how many additional members do they need?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>### Input:Where would you find a seafood restaurant in the east coast of North America? Choices:  A: maine B: boston C: beach town D: coastal cities E: ocean<n><n>### Response:		If you look at the choices, there is a slight difference in usage of definite articles or indefinite articles.<n>There are 2 things to note:<n>1.There is an indefinite article before 'town'. Town is not included in 'east coast of North America', which is a place that covers everything east of North America, and it should have 'the'.<n>2.When we are talking about multiple options or location, we use's'. We should put both article. Like 'C: beach towns', it should be 'C: beach towns'.<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Read the problem and fill in the blanks based on the input you were given.<n><n>### Input<n><n>### Input 2<n><n>### Instructed Response<n>* For 2, "There are 2 things" should be "There are three things". There are three possible choices. We use 'three' because it is more specific. It gives more detailed and more specific information than "2 things".<n>* The other thing we should note is that we use "If the club has 18 members now, how many ______ do they need?" for blank 3. They should have used "If the club _____ how many _____ do they need?" It is talking about what the club needs (members) right?<n><n>### Input3<n>* For 4, the question is about how to find a seafood place. "Which seafood restaurant..." was used. It's the only answer we can look for. <n>* The answer to 3 should be -5. We are trying to solve for x and they are trying to solve for'seafood place'. We are looking for the seafood place that is closest to the east coast of North American.<n><n>* For input 4, "A: maine is the closest to the east of coast North American' should be correct. There are a lot of choices and this is the closest choice.<n><n>### Output<n><n>### Instinctive Response<n>* Here is a list of output rules:<n>* Use 'the'<n>* Capitalize every country name and river names<n>* If there is more than one name, capitalize the first and keep lower-case until there is an article<n>Example:  "River Thames" is capitalized because it's a proper noun, but "A

If the cost of the book is increased by 30% then what would be its price?<n><n>### Response<n>Answer 17.5 <n><n>### Explaination<n>$15*(1.3)*$<n><n>### Response 2<n>Answer 17<n><n>### Explication<n>$15*1.30$<n><n>### Input A.<n><n>How much is $6 \times 2 \times 10^3 10^{74}$?<n><n>### Explicaction<n>$6 \times 2100 \times \frac{1}{2}$$^{74}$$<n><n>### Response B.<n>Tally of the number of the people who won a prize in a carnival game is as follows:<n><n>1 person won a book<n>10 people won a game voucher <n>2 people won a stuffed toy<n>5 people won a movie voucher<n>30 people won a 25% discount voucher<n>40 people won a 5% discount vocher<n>7 people won a $10 food voucher<n>150 people won a $1 movie voucher<n>25 people won a book voucher<n>87 people won a cake<n>12 people won a $3 food voucher<n>41 people won a $6 food voucher<n>234 people won a $1 food voucher<n>90 people won a $5 food voucher<n>How many people won a movie vauchers?<n><n>### Input - Response<n><n>34 people won it.<n><n>### Response - Explication<n><n>We know from the input that there are a lot of the people who won 1 movie voucher, we can do the sum of every prize that people won to have the grand total, and then use that total to find out the number of the people to get 34.<n><n>### ANSWER 1 <n><n>### A<n>How many of these are there?<n><n> ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------<n>| 7

She continued to do what? Choices:  A: gain weight B: augment C: dispare D: make larger E: expand<n><n>### Response:		<n>**(Choose from the given answers)** A<n><n>### Explanation:<n>She may have tried to gain more weight in general but failed miserably, but not her waist in particular. Hence, A is the correct answer. Other options fail to meet the criteria for the prompt.<n><n>### Input:-<n>The current price of a house is $123,467. If you increase 99.53% of the number, you get 29531. If you decrease 93.88% of the number, how close will you get to the original price?<n><n>### Expected Solution:-<n>You are looking to create two numbers using the 99.5 and 93.8 that give you as close to the original price as possible.  So we need numbers that equal or come close to 124,000.<n>To get there, we need to add 1700 so that it becomes 125,700. In order to go to 124000, you would reduce it by 1490. Hence, (125700)(0.17) rounded to the nearest thousand = 21892.25<n><n>### Solution:<n>To get there, you would reduce it 1490 and then add to the closest 100, which is 1491.<n><n>### Solution for Solution:<n>12400 = 125x700<n>12401 = 125.x701<n>12402 = 12502<n>...<n>124x700 = 1700<n><n>### What about that weird last problem where we were finding out the product of 125.7?<n><n>Why would we multiply by 0.17? If we have a number, let say 125000 and want to find the new number you get if we multiply by 1.17, we create a "new variable," let us call it "new number". We would say,<n><n>(12500.17) * 10,000 = 130500 new number<n><n>By using 0.17

But now, after buying a second machine to boost production they spent 75% as much.  How much do they now spend to produce ten widgets? Choices: A.  750.00 B. 788.00. C. 250.00 D. 75.00 E. 1150.00<n>### Response: D<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>- Read the instructions and the examples carefully.<n>- Make sure you understand the instruction and can explain the reasoning and methods necessary to solve the problem.<n>- For each problem you’re asked to solve:<n>- Read the problem very carefully.<n>- Decide which part of the problem you will work on and how many parts are there.<n>- Figure out what the problem is asking you to find (what you want to solve).<n>- Decide how to solve the problem. Be clear how you solved it and how your solution proves it works.<n>- Explain your solution, step-by-step.  What did you do and in what order?<n>- Include any information you may have used to help you solve the problem (such as previous work done).<n>- If you chose a certain path to solve the problem, explain both, why you went with that path and why you decided to change.<n><n>### Solutions:<n><n>Input: A store was holding a sale, where 47% of the hats sold, during the sale were twice the usual sales.  The store sold  1350 hts, if the store usually sells  1000 hats how many hats were the store holding before the sale?<n>A. 250<n>B

Choices:  A: serve food B: eat C: set table D: serve meal E: present bill<n><n>### Response:		<n>A<n><n>When a waiter/waitress serves food, they will bring you your meal which is what they are suppose to do when they ask you "what will the waiter do at the end of your meall?" The other option is to eat which is not an option for them at work because that is an action reserved for the restaurant at home or in private. "Set table/table setting" is not the same thing because when waiters/waitresses serve food, they will only set the table down and prepare the food. This only shows one option for the waiter/waitress.<n><n>### Input:"I am a huge fan of this restaurant."<n><n>### Response:"I am a huge _____". Choices: A: fan B: fanatics C: freak D: expert E: connoisseur<n><n>![Image Result for food words starting with f](https://s.alicdn.com/kf/H75251038Bc3139f275eF575Fc2b40b9Fb9.png_500x500.png)<n><n>We can see that this is not the correct word because the sentence is "I am a huge fan...", not "I am a huge ____...". The word "fan" is a noun and cannot be turned into something else.<n><n>The word "fan" can be described as a crazy person that loves someone or something that causes them to act crazy without any limits. This is why the word "fan" was chosen in order to describe the person in the sentence since they were crazy over this restaurant.<n><n>### Output:<n>Input: "I am a huge **fan** of this restaurant" <n><n>Output:"I am a huge **FAN** of this restaurant." <n><n>### Output:"The fan likes the athlete" <n><n>Output: "The fan likes the **athlete**." <n><n>## Problem 2<n><n>### Input":You are the biggest **fan** of this athlete!!"<n><n>### Output:{<n><n>* "I am the biggest **FAN** of **FAN** in this universe!!"<n><n>* "I like this athlete **fan**"<n><n>* "You are the biggest **FANfan** of this

Choices:  A: carried by people B: guard house C: fly D: follow ultralight airplane E: group together<n><n>### Response:		<n>Answer: B<n><n>### Instructions:Read the following question and choose an answer.<n><n>### Inputs:<n>How do geese normally fly from place to place?<n><n>### Instrument:Choose from "carried by people" to "group together"<n><n>### Response option:F<n><n>### Instructor's answer:<n><n>### Instant answer:Group<n><n>### Input Instructions<n>Write a function named 'is_prime' that accepts a number as an argument and returns true if it is prime, or false if false. Example: is_prime(8) yields true, whereas is_prime(9) yields false.<n><n>### Response Instructions<n>Write the required function<n><n>### Response<n>function is_prime(number){<n>    if(number == 1)<n>    return false;<n>    else{<n>        for(var i = 2; i < number; i++){<n>            if(number == i)<n>                return false;<n>        }<n>        return true;<n>    }<n>}<n>```<n><n>### Response justification<n>**Comment:**<n>When receiving the number variable, it is used with the condition to see when it gets a number less than itself, and it will return false<n>**Output:**<n>function "is_prime" is ready.<n>***<n><n>### Instance<n>Write a function named answer_multiple that accepts two numbers N1 and N2 as<n>arguments and returns the answer to the equation N1/N2.<n><n>### Function Instructions<n><n>### Instuctor response instructions<n>Write the required function  <n><n>### Response instructions<n>Write the required answer function

Type in the correct word (or phrase) that completes the sentence.<n><n>### Demo<n>Exercise is good for everyone on every level<n>Exercise<n>______________ for everyone on every level.<n><n>Exercise and sleep are essential for each _______'s well-being and _________.<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. They work for four hours and are then joined by 6 other people who also work at the same rate. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>Input: Jodi starts off walking 1 mile a day for 6 days a week.  On the second week, she walks 2 miles a day, 6 days a week.  On the third week, she walks 3 miles a day, 6 days a week. Finally on the fourth week, she walks 4 miles a day, 6 days a week.  How many miles has she walked in 4 weeks?<n>Answer: 60<n><n>Input: A club is going to get additional members so that they will have 5 more than twice their current number of their members. If the club has 10 members now, how many additional members do they need?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>### Input:I'm looking for alcohol and fried foods, any suggestions? Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. They work for four hours and are then joined by 6 other people who also work at the same rate. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>Input: Jodi starts off walking 1 mile a day for 6 days a week.  On the second week, she walks 2 miles a day, 6 days a week.  On the third week, she walks 3 miles a day, 6 days a week. Finally on the fourth week, she walks 4 miles a day, 6 days a week.  How many miles has she walked in 4 weeks?<n>Answer: 60<n><n>Input: A club is going to get additional members so that they will have 5 more than twice their current number of their members. If the club has 10 members now, how many additional members do they need?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>### Input:Sally lost her kite because she wasn't careful.  She thought that there was more string on the spool, but it slipped out of her fingers when she reached the what?. Choices:  A: child's hand B: the last straw C: hobby shop D: end of line E: toy store<n><n>### Response:		<n>This problem can be solved with the use of modulus operator. The given condition gives the number if string that was not spool out, then the answer is 90.<n><n>### Input <n><n>#### Q1.<n><n>This question asks you to find out the amount of money John paid for buying the two nut types together. Thus, the total cost of buying nuts is $18.<n><n>#### Q2.<n><n>James has to pay 480, which is equal to 20% increase of cost per gallon.<n><n>#### Q3.<n><n>There were two players who scored goals against Barca, and only two players can score that amount of goals. 30 represents one of the answers if the players both are able to score an equal number of goals respectively.<n><n>#### Q4.<n><n>It seems obvious that this problem can be solved by finding the average. 868 means that the number of times that each fluid was consumed. Tom consumed 60 fluid. Stella also consumed 60 fluids altogether.<n><n>#### Q5.<n><n>Every truck can hold 6000 stones blocks. Then, to fill up the truck, 6 workers are needed. There are 12 hours in a day, so multiplying the number of workers by 6, the workers can only fill the truck. Thus, the maximum amount of hours needed to fill up the truk is 6.<n><n>#### Q6.<n><n>The answer is 60; one from each member of the brothers.<n><n>#### Q7.<n><n>Queenie earns $1530 for 6 days (6*150) and $45 (1 day is 6 hours of overtime, while 4 hours is 1/3) = $1575, which is equal to $787.50 or 787.5.<n><n>#### Q8.<n><n>Jodi walked a total of 3 miles in 4 weeks.<n><n>#### Q9.<n><n>The club needs 6 members to reach their goal.<n>

How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. They work for four hours and are then joined by 6 other people who also work at the same rate. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>Input: Jodi starts off walking 1 mile a day for 6 days a week.  On the second week, she walks 2 miles a day, 6 days a week.  On the third week, she walks 3 miles a day, 6 days a week. Finally on the fourth week, she walks 4 miles a day, 6 days a week.  How many miles has she walked in 4 weeks?<n>Answer: 60<n><n>Input: A club is going to get additional members so that they will have 5 more than twice their current number of their members. If the club has 10 members now, how many additional members do they need?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>### Input:East coast areas such as Florida are found where? Choices:  A: florida B: denmark C: united states D: map E: california<n><n>### Response:		<n>answer with the correct answer for the question<n><n>### Input/response:Answer each question.<n><n>## 2. You will now see a list of 6 different code blocks.<n>### Instruction #2 (2):<n>Write a response for each of these 6 code blocks so that the program runs.<n><n># A<n># A<n># [1,2,3,4,5]<n><n># B<n><n>a = [1,2,1,3,5,7]<n><n>### C<n><n>### D<n><n>### E<n><n>### F<n><n>```<n>def summedNumbers(L):<n>    currentNumber = 0<n>    sum = []<n>    for i in L:<n>        currentNumber = currentNumber+i<n>    for i in range(currentNumber):<n>        sum.append(i)<n>return sum<n><n>```<n><n>### G<n><n>1. create a `def summedNumbers(numbers)` function.<n>2. create a `numbers ` list in the function.<n>3. sum all the numbers in the list.<n>4. for each number, save it to the sum array.<n>5. return sum array to the caller.<n><n>```<n>numbers<n>summedNumbers(numbers)<n>```<n><n>## Output:<n>```<n>Sum<n>```

If the short response contains multiple choice questions, put the choices in the order in which they should be chosen. If none of the answers to the multiple choice questions are correct, put “not sure.”<n>

How many miles has she walked in 4 weeks?<n>Answer: 60<n><n>Input: A club is going to get additional members so that they will have 5 more than twice their current number of their members. You are proud of your friend.<n><n>### Yes. I am proud of her.<n><n>### My mother is a doctor.<n><n>### Not mine.<n><n>### I wish I could play violin that well.<n><n>### So do I<n><n>### He is a musician.<n><n>### Is he a good musician?<n>### Yes. He can sing!<n>

Write your response in the format for multiple choice problems or true/false questions. One blank is to be worked on at a time.<n><n>### Input one:<n><n>### Demostration for input one:<n><n>## Input 2:<n>## Demostration for Input 2:<n><n>```python<n>def do_it(input1, _input2)<n>    print("Hello! My name is " + input1)<n>    print()<n>    print()<n><n>    if not _input2:<n>        print("That's nice that you know my name, but are you sure you know my age?")<n>    else:<n>        print("Nice to meet you. I'm {0}.".format(input1))<n>    print(input1, "is my name and I am {0} years old.".format(input2))<n><n>def do_it_again(p1, p2)<n>    do_it(p1, p1, p2) # Input 2 is no longer defined after input1 has been run<n>    print("...and I'm {0}, too!").format(p2)<n>```<n>

Choices:  A: hair salon B: hair of woman C: barber shop D: pincushion E: woman's hair<n><n>### Response:		Answer: A barber shop<n><n>**Why?:** We have narrowed down our place of work to hair care places because hair salons and barber shops do hair. That is why if we were to use the letter C, we could never use the letter B; it already refers to a hair salon. The only remaining choices are the A and D, because they each refer to only one type of workplace. I will eliminate the letter D because pincushions just hold pins, meaning the hairpin cannot be in an environment such as that. Hence, a reasonable assumption that the letter A refers to salons that cut and style hair.<n><n>### Input; How many ounces is 56 of a pound?<n><n>### Response;Answer:3 pounds<n><n>**Why?: 56 ounces/ 16ounces/pound x 16ounces equals to 3 pounds.**<n><n>### Input:- A certain hotel lets guests check in from 11 am to 3 pm, and check out at 11 am. How many guests may check out on a Sunday?<n>### Output:-5pm<n>### Hint: How many guests may check in and check out during a Sunday?<n><n>**Why?:2x the total number of guests that can be check in and out are required.**<n><n>## Other notes<n>- It is possible for me to use the language 'hence' and 'therefore' interchangeably.<n>- I sometimes get stuck in loops and never finish the question, or never get it right.<n>- I cannot apply the same strategy to each question, thus making it difficult for me to memorize.<n>- If a question states that the total number of guest is 500, that number would include check in and check out.<n>- Example: Question says, 'Find the median of 28?' 80 is my answer.  I don't see that the question ever asked me to find the median of 36 (28 + 8).  That's why I keep getting this type of question wrong in the exam.<n>- I tend to lose marks if I do not state the total number of guests.<n>- Some of these math question seem to be worded as trick questions.<n>- It is easier for me to come up with the answer by reading the question rather than listening. I

What country has the longest coastline if it does not touch the United States or Canada? Choices: A: Canada B: the Atlantic Ocean C: US D: the Bering Sea E: Russia<n><n>### Response:: Canada which is also the world's second biggest country by area and the third largest by population. Canada's longest coastline is along the Pacific Ocean.<n><n>##### The United States only has coastlines bordering the Atlantic Ocean and the Pacific Ocean, not the Bering Sea.<n><n>Canada's Atlantic coastline is overlooked in your response, however Canada's coastline includes the Atlantic (East), Arctic (North), and Pacific (West).<n><n>The country is bordered to the west by the Pacific Ocean and to the east by the Atlantic Ocean.<n><n>The Hudson Bay-Arctic Basin covers almost 1.2 million square kilometres of Canada's coastline. It stretches for 6,200 kilometres and is home to more than 50 species of wildlife, such as ice seals and ringed and harp seals.<n><n>The Canadian coastline is 202 080 kilometres long:<n><n>the Atlantic coast: 20 136 kilometres<n><n>the Pacific coast: 200 742 kilometres<n><n>the Arctic coast: 30 998 kilometres<n><n>##### It is possible that these questions were written with a North American flavor by default<n><n><i>Note: the term ocean has traditionally referred to the North Atlantic Ocean and the South Atlantic Ocean<n><n>https://www.britannica.com/science/ocean<n><n><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/St

How many of each should be in each field?<n>### Response: Both fields should contain 13 of each.<n>### Input: One night, a couple is walking down a dark path and a black cat crosses their path. The couple then walks on for a while before stopping at an intersection.  Across the street is a black cat and the man turns around and walks back.  He says to his wife, "Honey, if we don't move fast enough the cat will cross our path."  "What did the man do then?"<n><n>### Response A: He walked across the intersectiom to see if the dog was there.<n><n>### Input A: The man was a werewolf.<n><n>### Commentary The man walked across the intersection to see if the dog would cross the intersection. The dog crossed the intersection, so the couple walked past it.<n><n>### Answer: They were a human and a wolf.<n><n>## Instructions:<n><n>Write a response that appropriately replicates the problem given an input.<n><n>## Instruction:<n>Answer the following multiple choice problem. <n><n>## Instruction Answer:<n>1-6<n><n>## Revision:<n> 1 - Write the number that you see.<n> 2 - Write the correct number which comes after six.<n> 3 - Write the highest number in your group. If you have no group, that is not an option.<n> 4 - Put a minus before any number in your group which is lower than 1.<n> 5 - Write down the highest number in your division.<n> 6 - Write down the smallest number in your division. If this is a group you may have to change the number for each group.<n><n>##

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. They work for four hours and are then joined by 6 other people who also work at the same rate. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>Input: Jodi starts off walking 1 mile a day for 6 days a week.  On the second week, she walks 2 miles a day, 6 days a week.  On the third week, she walks 3 miles a day, 6 days a week. Finally on the fourth week, she walks 4 miles a day, 6 days a week.  How many miles has she walked in 4 weeks?<n>Answer: 60<n><n>Input: A club is going to get additional members so that they will have 5 more than twice their current number of their members. If the club has 10 members now, how many additional members do they need?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>### Input:What is made out of only one piece? Choices:  A: jigsaw puzzle B: chess game C: puzzle box D: jigsaw puzzel puxxle E: puxxle<n><n>### Response:		E: The puxxle is made entirely of one piece. There is no inside to a puxxle or a puxxle box.<n><n>- [x] The puxxle has one outside piece.<n>- [x] As you turn the puxxle, you are creating a maze by folding the puxxle into another shape.<n><n>### Input : A 25 foot ladder is leaning against a building. When extended all the way, it reaches to the window 75 feet up. The first four rungs on the ladder are three feet high, as are the next 4 rungs. The highest reach of the ladder is 15 feet. The distance to the window is 12.5 feet. How high is the highest reach point?<n>![](https://docs.google.com/drawings/d/1d9yUx2MXM5LrUqQkGI6xkp0HwvLpQyUwP/edit?usp=sharing)<n>![](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1mY2Bkq-DH05hUu23YRsjyCU_LGfjFmB1/view?usp=shari)<n><n>### Response : There are 21 rungs.<n><n>There are 21 rung on the ladder.<n>The rungs are 4 feet long each.<n>From the bottom of the ladder to the top, there are 21×2=41 feet<n>The first five rungs are 7 feet long, so there are 7 feet in each rung.<n>The six rungs are 6 feet long, so there 6×2 extra 12 feet in each rung<n>The 5th rung to 9th rung are 4 feet each.<n>The 9th rung to 13th rung are 5 rungs each.<n>The 12th rung to 21st rung are 3 feet each.<n><n>The first four rungs are from the base of the ladder to 75 feet.<n>From the first ladder to the first ladder, there are (75-3)-(2) = 100 feet

How many miles has she walked in 4 weeks?<n>Answer: 60<n><n>Input: A club is going to get additional members so that they will have 5 more than twice their current number of their members. If the club has 10 members now, how many additional members do they need?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>### Input:What happens to the conscience of someone who has been caught committing a murder? Choices:  A: jail time B: fear C: going to prison D: nothing E: feeling of guilt<n><n>### Response:		E<n><n>### Input<n>Murder is the worst thing that someone can do to another person and for someone to be caught and going to jail as a result of committing this crime, shows remorse and a desire not to repeat his crime again once he goes to jail.<n>### Response<n><n>### Input :What is the meaning of the idiom “sit on the bench”? <n><n>### Response A: to be unable to play a sport <n><n>### B: to go to war <n><n>### C: to be elected<n><n>### D: to wait for something to happen<n><n>### E sit on a bench<n><n>### Response : B<n><n>### Input A: I’m going to go over the cost of the new car project. Can you please tell me how it will affect my monthly premium?<n>A: That sounds great. Could you please tell me how we will affect my insurance policy?<n>B: Sure, how much will my insurance premium go up?<n>C: Would you be able to help me figure out where the extra money will come from?<n>C: Would it be possible for me to determine how much in premium I will have to pay?<n>B: I can see it increasing, but I just need to know where you expect the money will come from—<n>

Choices:  A: water cooler B: opera C: hospital D: hockey game E: beach<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>A water cooler is a place to get water for drinking in a house, office or workplace.<n><n>### Input:(There are some other choices but 21 of the students chose option A) What percentage did the students choose option A?<n><n>### Response:(27 choose option A) 27/21 = 1,314.3/41 = 0.41 = 41%<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n><n>### Inputs: The number of people attending a sports event 1.1 times in the past was 116.  If the number of people attending the same sports event in the 2nd year is 131, find out how many people attended the event in the 1st year.<n><n>### Response :<n><n>The answer is 52 people attended the event in 1st year. So, we can infer it as 116 * 1/2 * 1 = 52<n><n>### Input and Response:<n><n>The number of people attending in year 1 is multiplied twice with 1/2 in order to represent what happened in next year for both to find out what percentage of increase is.<n><n>In the number of percentage, we can find out the ratio of past and current and hence, percentage. We can interpret it as what percent is the resultant in comparison to the number in base year.<n><n>## Instructions:<n>A store's sales in three consecutive quarters are $32000, $39500 and $94000. Choices:  A: countryside B: anthology C: dull read D: state park E: surface of earth<n><n>### Response:		A<n>Input: There was a show on television<n><n>```julia<n>function show(arg1::Int, arg2::Int, arg3::Int)<n>```<n><n>### Comment: The function show takes three arguments, two of which must be positive <n>integer, and a third which must be a natural number. The function returns nothing.<n><n>### Demo 1:<n>#### Output:<n>```julia, run> show(1, 1, 30) <n><n>Output: 3<n>```<n><n>## Demo 2:<n>#### Output: <n>```julia <n><n>Output:<n><n>```julai<n>run> show 313<n>```<n><n>#### Remark: The first output returns the value 3 because 30 is the smallest <n>natural number that exceeds the 1,000-digit string "313."<n><n>## Demo 3:<n>```julian<n>run> show(1,30)<n><n>Output:<n>```julai, run> show(30,1)<n>```<n><n>#### remark: The second output returns the value 1 because it can be formed with<n>the 1,001-digit string "30313."<n>

Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n><n>### Response:		<n>1. A was good at traditional science, but he excelled at social science<n><n>---<n><n>### Input<n>The length of a rectangle is the number of hours he sleeps. The width of the rectangle is the number of minutes he spends on social media. What is the area of the rectangle?<n><n>### Response<n>Area = length = 8 ; width = 4 ; thus area = 8 × 4 = 32<n><n>### Input : Sally and Peter met at a cafe. Sally ordered a hot chocolate and a large salad, and spent $17.50 on drinks and $32.50 on salad. Peter ordered a double vanilla shot and double espresso, and spent $12.50 for drinks and $12.55 on his order. How much money did Sally have left to pay for her drinks and salad?<n><n>### Solution<n>Sally started with $77.50, spent $20.05, and still had $57.45.<n>Peter started with $104.05, spent $36.10, and still had $67.95.<n><n>### Input(s): John and Julia are in John’s car. Julia’s seat is in the front seat and John’s is in the back.  If John is 5 feet tall and Julia is 6 feet tall and John’s seat is 3 feet from the back wall of the car, how far from the front wall is John’s seat?<n><n>### Answer<n>4.5 ft from the front wall<n><n>### Input (s): John’s father and John’s mother are in the living room while John sits at the table. However, when John eats, John sits on the same chair as his father’s chair. How many times does John eat?<n><n>### Sol’n<n>7 x 25 = 175 meals<n><n>### Inputs : 51<n>23 42<n>18<n>16<n>49<n>#### Note : Input should be numbers<n><n>

He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. They work for four hours and are then joined by 6 other people who also work at the same rate. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>Input: Jodi starts off walking 1 mile a day for 6 days a week.  On the second week, she walks 2 miles a day, 6 days a week.  On the third week, she walks 3 miles a day, 6 days a week. Finally on the fourth week, she walks 4 miles a day, 6 days a week.  How many miles has she walked in 4 weeks?<n>Answer: 60<n><n>Input: A club is going to get additional members so that they will have 5 more than twice their current number of their members. There are two types of trees on the planet: evergreen firs and deciduous maples. One is a coniferous tree and the other is a broadleaf. They can be identified by a series of features. A coniferous tree has five needle leaves, its leaves are arranged in an alternating pattern, and each needle has a greenish-brown color. On the other hand, a broadleaf has three leaflets, its leaves are arranged alternating pairs, the leaves are arranged with a green center and white stripes, and the edges of the leaves are yellowish-green. What type of tree is an evergreen Fir?<n><n>### Tips<n>1. Be thorough: Make sure that you look at all angles to make sure you answered each part of the problem correctly<n>2. Read the problem carefully: Make sure that you read the question all the way through and understand what is specifically being asked<n>3. Know your formulas: Being proficient in elementary skills is helpful, and is often the key to answering challenging questions and moving on in your academic career<n>4. Pay attention to directions: If a question asks you to use a certain formula, make sure you do so exactly how the question asks you to. You don’t want to get a wrong answer because you were using the wrong formula, or missed an “important” variable somewhere in the math<n>5. Practice, practice, practice: The math is one of the most important aspects to the SAT, and it can’t be improved without practice. Work hard on your formulas, memorize different functions and identities, and understand all you can about them.<n>- What do we know about Elijah?<n><n>### Exercises: What do we know about James?<n>#### 1.<n>|Elijah is a good friend of Doris and a team player. How many miles has she walked in 4 weeks?<n>Answer: 60<n><n>Input: A club is going to get additional members so that they will have 5 more than twice their current number of their members. If the club has 10 members now, how many additional members do they need?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>### Input:What happens when you take a shower after going for a run? Choices:  A: feeling refreshed B: becoming tired C: restlessness D: leg cramps E: sweating<n><n>### Response:		<n>![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/78028739/140546436-91ee9737-1a91-4c41-898c-a14ba5bf05be.png)<n><n>> Causation<n><n>Ever wondered why you feel refreshed after a shower? It is because your body sweats out all the gains metabolic energy. After taking a shower after running, your body feels light because of the extra fluid in your body being released.<n><n>### Input<n>How to reduce a number<n><n>### Response<n>You can use any of the operations * and /.<n>![Alt text](/img/2021-04-19-010857.png " ")<n><n>### Input How to round a number<n><n>## Response<n>There is a quicker way of rounding a number without using modulo.<n><n>### You are looking at a row of 3-digit numbers. Choices:  A: work hard B: slow down C: wear shoes D: sell products E: speed up<n><n>### Response:		Ali should slow down<n><n>### Input<n><n>Input: Mary has 5 boxes and wants to send them in 2 boxes in order to save money. The boxes are as tall as they are long and in inches, in terms of area, are 3516, 7010, 1290, 81 and 100? What’s the largest container she can use?<n>Response: I answered the problem this way:<n><n>Step 1: Find smallest and largest box. These are 6×6×2 and 2×5×5 respectively. <n><n>Step 2: Use 6×6×5 as it is bigger that 3516 and smaller than 7010<n><n>Step 3: Use 5×5×5 as it is a smaller box<n><n>Step 4: I find the difference of the 2 boxes( 24×6×5 and 24×5×5) which comes to 120<n><n>Step 5: This is the difference in the area between the 2 boxes I need<n><n>Step 6: If I want to take 2 boxes of the area 120 then what should each box be( 6×6)<n><n>Step 7: Box dimensions for both the boxes should be 6×6<n><n>I used the formula in step 6 and 8 to solve for the dimensions<n><n>### Output:<n>Input: a=1;b=3;c=4;d=7;h=12;i=15;k=8;p=-16;q=4;r=-7;e=-6;g=5<n><n>Output: Find 90° angle<n><n>### Input and Output:<n><n>Input1: 435.  Response: 9.15  <n><n>Input2 : 5853. Response:968.91  <n><n>### Input, output,instruction:<n><n>#### Instruction: Answer the following multiple choice question using code<n><n>#### Demonstration: <n><n>Code: #include and int <n><n>Input<n><n>int n int a int b<n><n>int c<n><n>Output<n><n>int d<n><n>Response<n><n>if (a >=3 && b==2){<n>  d=3-c<n>}

He found his way into the library so he could have a place for a refuge. He also have some trouble how to say and write his name properly and was very proud when the teacher showed him how. But he wanted to read, he couldn’t, so he asked the teacher to help him. He want to practice writing and reading every day, he had been working since he was 6 years old. He was hoping his grandpa would be a little happier and have a lot of friends at library. He thought is time to give him a change of place. Alex is really glad to work with his grandpa because he thinks it was a great achievement for a whole life. Alex was 9 years old when he learned to read.

Choices:  A: feeble B: bullbleep C: cow D: female E: charging prey<n><n>### Response:		The correct answer is A. "Call bull" is an expressive statement of incredulity. "Bull" is something that isn't true. "A bull" is a male that doesn't exist. "He called bull" is an expression of incredulity. It means that he said what his friend was saying wasn't true. The answer is A. "Feeble" means weak or powerless. "Bull" means a male bovine. The correct answer is A.<n><n>### Input:"The number of goals scored in some football league are a little less than 3 times the number of goals scored by exactly two players in a season of the same league plus 2 times the number of goals by 2 players in the league. Choices: 3 9,1 0,B 4, D 11<n><n>### Response D<n>    <n>### Assignment<n>Choose 3 toys you want from the Toys R Us website, and find their prices. Write a formula that returns the price of the cheapest item in your group. To write a formula, follow the steps given below.<n><n>1) First type the equals sign =, then type an opening formula.<n><n>2) Select the first item from your group.<n><n>3) Double-click to write your first formula.<n><n>4) Then enter the formula you have written and type =. You type = as a shortcut for Evaluate.<n><n>5) Repeat steps 2 and 3 for the second item, then repeat the entire procedure for the third item.<n><n>6) Press Enter to evaluate your formula and then press Enter again for the next formula in your group.<n><n>### Response <n><n>```<n>=MIN($B12, $C12, $D12)<n>```<n><n>### Outputs:<n>    A: The cheapest toy is the $32.38 one<n>    B: The cheapest to toy is the $ 6 one<n>    C: the cheapest toy is $12.52<n>

Therefore the number of seasons a player scored 11 goals in was 7.<n><n>### Explanatison:<n>In seven seasons, 7 players that scored 11 goals.<n><n>### Input <n>Denis bought 7 pizza. The shop charged $2 more for the extra pizza slice. How much did he spend?<n><n>### Response <n>$23.<n><n>### Justification<n>A pizza costs $8 for a sliced pizza. The extra price per pizza is $2. Extra price of seven pizzas is $39. Extra price of the first 7 pizzas is $8 times 7 is $56. Extra price of 1 is $2. The extra price for 7 pizza is $56 and an extra price for 7 is $59. The extra cost for 8 pizza is $2 which is the extra price for the last pizza slice.<n><n>

So we have 3*3*3=99<n><n>### Error<n>Input:The price of something is $8.50, and its units digit is 8. Is this true? Why or why not?<n>2. Try to explain mathematically.<n>3. Try to explain intuitively.<n><n>### Answer<n><n>This is not true because if you leave only 1 fish, that single fish wouldn't be considered tons, which is why they were able to catch even 6 tons of fish in the first place.<n><n>### #2<n><n>### Challenge:<n>Let me know in case of the answer, and for questions.

A: Double the number and add 5 More B: Subtract 4 from the number or 3 if less than 4. C: Subtract 7 from the number or 10. D: Subtract 2 from the number if the number is positive subtract 2 from the negative number. E: Add 7 to the number or 3 More if the number is negative.<n><n>#### Answer : C<n><n>##### 7-4 = 3, 2-1 = 1, 7-1=6<n><n>### The number of chairs in a room add 4 of 27 is 69 which when doubled the number is 14. What is the original number?<n><n>#### Answer - 54<n><n>### Find the number. 4: Add 3 more than the number to get a new number. Multiply the new number by 4 to get the number. 5: Subtract 6 from the number. Then double the number. Multiply by 100.<n><n>####

Choices:  A: supermarket B: kitchen cupboard C: table D: flea market E: dishwasher<n><n>### Response:		A; C<n><n>### Input The number of goals scored against a team last season accounts for 80 % of all goals scored in their league against a specific club how many clubs did they face?<n><n>### Response 16<n><n>### Input James earns $15 an hour. After 4 years, he will earn $60 an hour. To be able to make at least $15, he must work less than a 1000 hours in 4 years. How many hours does he have to work to make $15 an hour?<n><n>### Responses: 230 or 240 hours<n><n>### Input A man needs to buy a 100 kg box of sand for one week for gardening, but the box he buys was 90 kg, he needs to get a box of sand the next week for only 3 kg. Which box is better value?<n><n>### Choices:<n><n>* A. 1:10 = 10 kg a week <br> B. 1:9 = 10 kg <br> C. 1:90 = 10 <br> D. 1:19 = 9 kg<n><n>### Response B<n><n>### Input 1) Tom drinks 5 cans of soda and 64 ounes of water per day. How many litres of fluids does he consume in a day?<n><n>### Answer: 9.5 litres<n><n>### Input Tom drinks 10 cans of soda<n><n>### Answer 6<n><n>### input 2) Tom drinks 6 cans of soda, 3 cans of tea, and 3 cans of juice. How much fluid does he drink in total?<n><n>### 15 litres(7.5 cans ×7 ounces = 56 fluid ounces = 16 cups = 1 gallon)<n><n>### Input the number of stone blocks in a truck accounts for 50% of the stones in a mine how many stone blocks does the mine have?<n><n>### A. 20 stone blocks <br> B.16 stone blocks <br> C.15 stone blocks <br> D.14 stone blocks<n>

She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>Input: Jodi starts off walking 1 mile a day for 6 days a week.  On the second week, she walks 2 miles a day, 6 days a week.  On the third week, she walks 3 miles a day, 6 days a week. Finally on the fourth week, she walks 4 miles a day, 6 days a week.  How many miles has she walked in 4 weeks?<n>Answer: 60<n><n>Input: A club is going to get additional members so that they will have 5 more than twice their current number of their members. If the club has 10 members now, how many additional members do they need?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>### Input:Food must be freeze dried before it is taken on what vehicle? Choices:  A: fairgrounds B: friend's house C: space shuttle D: oven E: microwave<n><n>### Response:		The correct answer is A, it must be freeze drized at the fairgrounds before transport.<n><n>### Input : I want a bag of chips. A:  I only drink tea bag B: I am a tea bag C: How many days are there in a year<n><n>### Response : The correct answer is C, there are 365 days in a year.<n><n>### The task instructions: Choose the correct pair(s) of matching descriptions. You can use them wherever the question is asking for one or more people, places, things, or concepts to be matched.<n><n>### Demo:<n>There are four children and six adult men, and the six adult women.<n><n>There are three adults in Australia and 15 adults on the moon.<n><n>There are five pets and a large field.<n><n>Answer: 4 people and 9 animals<n>5 people and 3 animals<n>10 people and 1 pet<n><n>### Response and Answer:<n>#### Input :There are four children and three adults.<n>#### Response <n>The four children must be matched with the three adults.<n><n>#### Answer  - 4 children and 3 adults.<n><n>### This task instructions match.<n><n>Choose the correct pair(S) of matching descriptions of two people or things. You can use them where ever you need to match people or things.<n><n>There are two pairs of shoes.<n><n>There are 13 crayons and 26 books.<n><n>There are seven crayons and 13 books.<n><n>There is no shoes and two books.<n><n>There 3 crayons and six books.<n><n>There a pair of books and five shoes.<n><n>Demonstrate how to find a pair of matching descriptions.<n><n>Answers : There is 2 pairs of shoes. There are 3 crayons.<n>### Response and answer<n>Answers :<n>- Two adult men and one adult woman.<n>- Two books.<n>- Two pairs of shoes.

Choices:  A: amount to nothing B: visit relatives C: charming D: doctor himself E: cross street<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Input and output:What are your plans to celebrate Christmas?<n><n>### A) Go to the Carnival<n><n>### B) Eat cakes<n><n>### C) Buy a new car<n><n>### D) None<n><n>### E) Buy a house<n><n>### A, D, C<n><n>### Input-write a program that inputs marks into grades. Mark 1=A+1,2=A,3=A-,4=B+1,5=B,6=B-,7=C+1,8=C,9=C-,10=D+1,11=D,12=D-,13=E+1,14=E,15=E-,16=failed.<n>Output-write a program that writes a report that marks the student’s grade in any subjects<n><n>### <n><n>### Solution:<n><n>```csc<n>#include <n><n>function main:<n>  input:marks <n><n>	mark[] : store the marks<n>	count[] //store the no of subjects<n>	markscnt:store the grade for each subject<n>	grade[]:store the total grade in each subject<n>	int x=0 : store the total  grade<n><n>   //input subject name &marks entered<n>	for(i=1 to noofsubjects) <n>	do{<n>		i=i+1<n>		putstr(i:prompt for subject name<n>			input and store marks<n>			incre1:count++<n>			<n>		end<n>	}<n><n>	//to get the grade for each subject <n>	for(i =1 to count[]) <n>	<n>		for(c=1 to noofmarkscnt)<n>		do<n>			s=marks[c]<n>			g=grade[c]<n>	<n>		incre2:int x=x+g<n>	<n>		p=x+s<n>	<n>		totalmarkscnt[c] = totalmarkscnt[c]+1<n>	<n>	next<n><n>	//to check wether student passsed or fell in any subject<n><n>	for(i[1 to noofsubject])<n>	do<n>		if

If the club has 10 members now, how many additional members do they need?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>### Input:What  might john order at an indian resturant on top of the space needle? Choices:  A: large city B: seattle C: curry D: clothing E: reservation<n><n>### Response:		The correct answer is A because Seattle's population is 700 thousand people (Wikipedia, 2014), so it is a "large city."
