Choices:  A: cupboard B: cabinet C: own home D: everything E: garbage dump<n><n>### Response:		Answer: E (garbage dump)<n><n>### Input:(A) A set will have no more more than eight elements,and a collection will have between three elements,and no more than 20.Which of the following is correct?<n><n>### Response:(b) A set must end with a 20,and a collection must end with a 15.<n><n>(b) A set must start with a 5,and a collection must start with a 3.<n><n>(b),(a) or (d)<n><n>(a) A set <n>must start with a 5.<n><n>(a) And (b) A collection must end<n>with a 14.<n><n>(a), (b), or (c)<n><n>A set must end with a number between 1 and 8.<n><n>### Explanation:<n><n>I have an instruction and a program,the instruction asked me to write a program.And I'm gonna explain the whole part of the task here.<n><n>We have a set of elements,all the program need to do is tell us which are plastic things.We all know that a cupboard contains a lot of things and we can't count all of them in one time,for example:there is a container in cupboard with a lid.And there is a box in cupboard with a handle(if you don't know what a handle is,look it up in a dictionary)and there are things in the box which we have to count.So,the whole program consist of four conditions:if(element is container)<n>and one more condition if(element is plastic).<n><n>It's very important to make the condition true or no,all of a number in collection starts with 3 and ends with 15,if the answer is not 3 or no the set will have more than 8 elements.<n><n>### Input:#=<n><n>10: 11,12,13<n><n>40:<n>9,10,11,12<n><n>3: 3,4,5,6<n><n>1:<n>7,8,9,10,<n><n>1: 1<n><n>(5: 5,6,7,8<n><n>3: 9,10, 11<n><n>4: 12,13

Solve it in Python.<n><n>### Acknowledgement:<n>Written by: Hieu Luu<n><n>### 1.<n>This is a simple problem about the sum of two numbers.<n>```python<n>a, b = map(int,input().split())<n>c = a + b<n>print(c)<n>```<n><n>### 2.<n>This is a harder problem that I modified. I took a different approach to solve it.<n>```python<n>c = [a]<n>d = [1]<n>n = 1<n>while d!= []:<n>    if n >= len(a):<n>        break<n>    c.append(a[n] + d[len(d)])<n>    c.append(((len(c) * 2) + n)* (n+1))  <n>    n += 1<n>print(c)    <n>```<n><n>## Instructions:<n><n>## InstruCTIONS:<n>Write at least one short paragraph.<n><n>## Acknowledgement:(Written by: Niharika Chauhan)<n><n>## 1.<n>I decided to be a good person because I love this world and I would like to see it as beautiful as I see it is now. I can’t think of a way to give back to others. If someone needs me and I help that person and then that person helps someone else then I think it's good.<n><n>## 2.<n>I don’t want to take a job in that industry. I want to be a nurse because I think that I will be happy and feel good doing that. If I could choose a second job I would want to be a business man because I believe that in the end being a business man provides a better future for my family. When I have children I want to make sure that they will have a better life than yours. I want them to go to the best schools, get food, and clothes and do whatever they want to.<n><n>## InstrucTIONs:<n><n>## Instruction:Answer the question: Which of the following could be the largest possible integer that you would expect to be returned by floor?<n>Answer: 231.232<n><n>## Instructon:Answer the following Multiple Choice Question.<n><n>##

To how many volumes am I converting?"<n><n>### Response:"If x liters of saline are required to prepare one liter of saline solution, then there are 4.4x liters in four and a half liters. As a result, her creation lost one of its wings and she couldn't even fly it.  How many times did Luna fold the paper to construct her plane?<n><n>### Response:(4) Answer is “F”<n><n>### Question:<n><n>How many of the following are even numbers?<n><n>### Choices:(1, 3, 5, 7)<n><n>### Response (1) Choice Answer is "E"<n><n>### Task:<n><n>Choose the choice that shows each pattern.<n><n>### Choice (1):Answer is "F"<n><n>### Input<n><n>Dan's plane ticket cost $390.  His train ticket cost $190 but was more than one sixth the price of the plane ticket.  How much was the train ticket?<n><n>### Answer:(A)<n><n>### Description<n><n>This can be solved by using the distributive property.<n><n>```JavaScript<n>$ = train ticket<n><n>$ = $190<n><n>$$ = $190 \times \frac{1}{6}<n><n>$ = 31<n>```<n><n>### Solution<n><n>$190 \times  \frac{1}{4} = $190 divided by 4<n><n>### Response<n><n>### Question<n><n>If you have 6 oranges, 7 apples, and 5 pears, what is the total of your fruit?<n><n>### Chosen Answer: Answer is "G"<n><n>### Response Answer: If you have 6 apples, 3 pears, and 2 grapes, then the total number of fruit would be: 6+3+2= 11<n><n>### Question 2:<n><n>How many bicycles are there in all these pictures?<n><n>### Image Answer:<n><n>### Chose the answer that represents this pattern.<n><n>## Questions:If an apple costs 3 euros and a banana costs 1.5 euros, how much would 25 bananas and 50 apples cost together?<n><n>### Input Question<n><n>Evaluate this expression

What is the hourly speed of the bus now?<n><n>### A response: Answer B<n><n>### Input:-13 * -7 =<n><n>### Response:-89<n><n>### Input : A fruit seller charges extra money for apples (20 cents for each) and for pineapples (40 cents for each). If a customer has 72 dollars and only buys apples, how much extra does the seller charge him?<n><n>### Answer: 5 dollars<n><n>### Input :- When you have an account at the bank, how much money for a check depends on whether the check was written for more or less money than the balance of your account.<n><n>### A: The amount that the customer can be charged for a check depends on how much money he/she has.<n><n>### B: The amount the customer can be charged depends on how much money  the bank gives the client as a loan.<n><n>### C: The amount that the client can get for a check depends on the amount they have with the bank account.<n><n>## Answer B<n><n>## Input :- A fruit seller charges more money for apples (30 cents each) and for pears (50 cents each). However, she offers a "special" where one fruit is given for every 3 fruits and the "special" is free if one has more than 10 fruits.  If someone has only 4 fruits in the 15 she pays for a pear and 6 apples. How much does she pay for the 15 fruits?<n><n>## Answer B (A customer will pay for 10 free fruits)<n><n>

He may be asking for a different place where the movie theater is. I don’t know if he actually wants a different place to find a movie theater.<n><n>### ANSWER: D<n>### Explanations:<n>Downtown area<n><n>The definition of downtown is a specific area in a town or city.<n><n>New York City<n><n>The definition of new york city is a city located in the northeastern United States.<n><n>Shopping mall<n><n>The definition of shopping mall is a large building or area that has many different shops, stalls, and fast-food restaurants for shopping.<n><n>Military base<n><n>The definition of military base is a place where military forces such as army, navy, air force, and coast guard are based.<n><n>### Input<n>John and Anna were talking about their upcoming vacation. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>Input: Jodi starts off walking 1 mile a day for 6 days a week. The silverware costs exactly 5% more than the silver and the silver costs exactly twice the silver. How much does each piece of silverware cost the woman?<n>### Response : The woman spends $125,000 to 3/4 of the silver. She owns 75,000 silver, and her silver costs half as much as her silver, which we can now calculate, is $325,00, which when multiplied by 2 gives us 650 thousand, which is 3/4 of silver.  Thus, the silverware costs around $155,000, which we can just calculate as 15 multiplied by 10,000 plus the $150,000 she spends on silver. Her silverware costs $155,325, which is also 11% more expensive than what it was, which is $155,600.<n><n>### Input  How many pairs of pants are there in 2,825 pounds of pants?<n><n>### Correct Answer  = $1,000,000<n>

The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>Input: Jodi starts off walking 1 mile a day for 6 days a week. How many miles has she walked in 4 weeks?<n>Answer: 60<n><n>Input: A club is going to get additional members so that they will have 5 more than twice their current number of their members. Choices:  A: damage B: cloud mind C: lower i.q D: cause illness E: cause accidents<n><n>### Response:		C: lower i. q<n><n>### Input 2:Choices:  There are 60 cards in a deck.  The top 5 cards are face up. We pick one at random. Then, we pick another one at random. We remove the face up card and it is no longer in our hand. If the face down card is also no longer a face up card, then we can replace it with the face up card. Then, we proceed to do this until none of the face down cards are face up cards. We start with 4 face up cards. How many face up cards will we have at the end?<n><n>### Response 2: 35<n><n>### Instructions<n>#### Demonstration: <n><n>Write a program that demonstrates any of the instructional examples.<n><n>#### Example<n>```<n>Input: 7<n>Output: 129<n>```<n><n>#### Response<n>```<n>def sum(num)<n>i = 1<n>while i <= num<n>   puts(i)<n>   i = i + 1<n>end<n>end<n>```<n><n>### Task 1: Write a program that will solve this.<n><n>Demonstration<n>```ruby<n>input : 7<n>output : 129<n>`<n>```<n><n>Code<n>```ruby<n>def sum(num){<n>  i = 1<n>  while i <= num<n>    puts(i)<n>    i = i + 3<n>    end<n>}<n>end<n>```<n>#### Instructions<n>Write a program that solves this. This is a new question that you are working on.<n><n>### Task2:Writing code<n>Your job is to write code that will compute the output below for any input numbers. Choices:  A: hole B: television C: sporting goods store D: pool table E: sporting event<n><n>### Response:		D.<n><n>### Inputs:<n>    How much does XYZ sell those items for?<n><n>    Z = 100<n>    Y = 20<n>    X = 80<n><n>### Response <n>	I'm going to use X for X, Y for Y and Z for Z, okay? So <n><n>$$X - 80$$<n>$$Y - 20$$<n>$$Z - Z$$<n><n>and $2X + 5Y = 330$, right? So we get that<n><n>$$X + 2Y + 6Z = 330$$<n><n>And we want to solve for X, Y and Z<n><n>to find what they are selling it for<n><n>we want Z, we have 6 times Z = 330, and we'll use<n><n>$$X + Y$$<n><n>since that's the only variable left in there and<n><n>$$2X + Y = Z$$<n><n>And we'll factor and subtract X and Y from both sides, so X = 40, Y = 15, and Z = 120.<n><n>### The first question, where would people see people in uniform playing? The choices were Hole, television, sporting goods store, pool table, and sporting event. <n><n>### Answer:E, there's only one, which means that you're going to see people in uniform playing in sporting events.<n><n>### In one school, there are 150 students and 30 teachers.  A third of the students are older than the teachers.  How many students are older than the oldest teacher?<n><n>### Answer:"There are 150  students"<n><n>### "There are 30  teachers, and"<n><n>### "[and] of the students are older."<n><n>### Response:"Well,  [so you could use 150]  students."<n><n>### "The teachers are 30, right?"<n><n>### "...which means there are 120 [and that] are older."<n><n>---<n><n>### Input 4<n>Where would you see people talking?<n><n>Answer: A. Gym, b. at the bar, and c. on the phone.<n><n>---<n><n>####

Choices:  A: factory B: construction site C: engine D: insides of skyscraper's walls E: shops<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Input, a: 2.6, b: 3.0, c: 3.2, d: 3.4, e: 3.6<n><n>### Response, a: 2 4ths, b: 7 4ths, c: 5 10ths, d: 9 10ths<n><n>### Response<n><n>### Input a: 75, b:28, c:9, d:6<n><n>### Solution<n><n>### 1.  2 4ths + 1 half + 20 4ths +1 half = 1 whole <n><n>### 2.  a3 + <n>2. 232 <n>a4 - <n>a5 <n>b5 <n>c3 <n>c3 + <n>c4 <n>c4 - <n>c1 <n>b3 - <n>b1 <n>74 <n>74 - <n>200 <n>a6 <n>a6 - <n>a5 + <n>a3 + <n>198 <n>200 - <n>100 <n>73 <n>73 - <n><n>### Task<n>Add 2 different fractions<n><n>### Example 6<n>### Input:How many cups of liquid do the two boys drink to find the <n><n>36 36 = 36 36<n><n>###  Input: A: 50, b: 50, c: 50, d: 50<n><n>7. 50 + 50 - 50 + 6 + 75 - 75 + 75 + 8 + 8 + 9<n>

Choices:  A: store B: classroom C: backpack D: cabinet E: teacher<n><n>### Response:		<n>The student did not have enough pencils and need to go to the store.<n><n>### Input:- 10 students needed to borrow some pencils,- 5 students were in the classroom, - 6 students needed pencils, - 3 students were in the kitchen,- 1 students were in the class, where did the remaining student go? Choices: A: store B: backpack C: teacher D: the school nurse E: home<n><n>### Response:- 3 of the 5 in the classroom had pencils, so 2 students needed pencils. -5 -3 = 2, so there were 2 students that did not have pencils. The remaining 3 students would have been left over, or borrowed the remaining pencils from the 5 students in the classroom. The rest 1 student went home.<n>

To get the amount of teaspoons in 12, we would divide 12 teaspoons by 2 to find the answer. We get 6 teaspoons in a dozen.<n><n>### Input <n><n>>How many days are there in 365?<n><n>### Inputs<n><n>>How many hours are there in 48?<n><n>>How many miles are in the state of Maine?<n><n>>How tall is a double decker bus?<n><n>>What is the average speed of sound?<n><n>>How fast do bacteria multiply?<n><n>### Responses<n>![Response 2](./img/response.png)<n>![Response 3](./img/Response-3.png)<n>![response 4](./img/Response.png)<n><n>### Demstration<n>The function `round` rounds a number to a nearer whole number<n>### Instruction <n>>The function `round`rounds a number to the `nearest`multiple of 0.<n><n>### Response

You could use if...then statement to create multiple choices.<n><n>**1.0 If the cat is home**<n>    A: box<n>    B: home<n>    C: alley<n>    D: lap<n>    E: barn<n>**1.1 If the cat is lap**<n>    A: home<n>    B: box<n>    C: ally<n>    D: lap <n>    E: lap<n>**1.2 If the cat is lap & home**<n>    A(home): lap<n>    B(lap): home<n>    C(ally): box<n>    D(ally): lap<n>    E(lap): lap<n><n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>Answer the following questions.<n><n>### Input<n>Input: A club owner wants to increase attendance by 40%. How many people must turn up to double the number of previous attendees?<n><n>### Response<n>Response: 68.3 people<n><n>### Instucter Notes:<n><n>If you use the if then statement and the assignment operator as shown in the code below, you will get the correct answer for the input in the question above.<n><n><n>### Input to Write<n>Input: In an orchestra consisting of string instruments, woodwind instruments, and brass instruments, how many members are there in the following groups: <n>    - 4 clarinets, 3 flutes, 4 oboes, 3 bassoons, and 5 saxophones.<n>Response to Write: 0<n><n>### Instuctor Notes:<n><n>You can't use the if..then statement in the question because the number of instruments is not predetermined. It can change from time to time. And because this question involves arithmetic, it'd better use the assignment operator. By assigning each of the groups of instruments, you'll be dividing the total members of the orchestra equally among the 3 groups of instruments. <n><n>### Instracutor Notes2<n><n>The number of instruments in each category must also be equal in order to divide them equally.<n><n><n>## 4) Instruction:What is the difference between the ages of Evelina and Diana six years ago? Write a program to find the answer.<n><n>### Answer<n>-Evel

He travels to malls to purchase a few of mall’s products. He is asked to meet his old friend, Amy. Amy lives closer to the mall by driving at the same speed. How many hours does John takes from mall and how many hour does Amy takes?<n><n>## #Response:Given that John travels 125 miles within an hour, John reaches the mall in 9 hours. Therefore his friend reaches mall after 125/1

Choices:  A: bus stop B: graph C: post office D: grass E: play<n><n>### Response:		Write a statement that could be added to the diagram.<n><n>Input:<n><img src="{{site.baseurl}}/assets/images/535/problem-5" width="550"><n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following mathematical question.<n><n>## Demonstration: (no demonstration)<n><n>Answer:<n><img src="/assets/images/380/problem-5-solution"  width="550" padding="0" ><n><img src="/snippets/5ed8e6668a6d3f0012d322c2/easy" width="554"><h3>Explanation</h3><p>The solution is not obvious here, yet the answer is very simple. </p><n><p>The correct answer is 39.</p><n><p class="mb-5">Solution</p><n><div class="solution-code"><n>```python3<n>for i in range(1,10):<n>    for j in range(1,j):<n>        if i<j:<n>            break<n>        elif i==j:<n>            break <n>        print(i,j+1)<n>```<n></div><n><n>### Instinct:Answer the following multiple statement.<n><n><div><n>Input:<img src="/assets\images\380\problem-5"  width="1080"><n></div><n><div class=instinct><n>Input:<n><div class="instinct-line1"><n><p>A</p><n></div><n>Input:<n><n><div class=" instignt_lines 1-2"><n><div class=" first-line"><n><p>B</p><n></p><n><p>"The diagram shows the location of 535 shops in the area. A or B?<n><n>### Response Answer:A<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>### Input A: A company buys a new shipment of widgets for 9% less than the manufacturring cost. In one week they sell 5600 widgets at a cost of $4.20 to wholesale customers. A: Calculate the % discount the factory bought the widgets at B: Calculate the the percentage markup the factory adds to sell the widgets the next week C: Calculate the profit from selling the widgets the next 5600 D: Calculate how much money the factory receives the next week for selling all 5600 of the widgets<n><n>### Response A: B, C, D<n>### Input B: A company buys widgets for 9 percent less than manufacturering cost. A: Calculate discount the factory buys the widgets for. B: Calculate the profit the factory makes from selling the widget the next week. C: Calculate how much the factory sold the widget the next for D: Calculate how many widgets are sold<n>### Response B: C, D<n><n>### Input C: 1st: The people in class think creative 2nd: The people in class talk about ideas 3rd: The people in class shake hands 4th: The people in class control events 5th: The people in cass try to dress themselves 6th: The people in a class brainstorm 7th: The people in the class dress correctly 8th: The people in clan discuss events 9th: The people in they dress appropriately 10th: The people in cla brainstorm ideas<n>### Response C: 8th, A<n><n>### Input D: A company bought new widgets for 9.1% less than its manufacturing costs. This week it sold 5,600 widgets for $4.20 each to wholesalers. The widget company buys widgets A: B: C: D:<n>### Response D: C<n><n>### Input E: A: the people in class brainstorm ideas, choose A or B B: the people in class shake Hands

She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>Input: Jodi starts off walking 1 mile a day for 6 days a week. When you look into your garage, you always know which vehicle is parked.<n>* 2. If a vehicle is parked, it does not have any motion.<n>* 3. A parked car can still have its engine running.<n><n>### Challenges:<n>The instructions say that: "Pick two challenges to attempt for your groupmates. Your prompt will be the numbers as text, and the array created. The goal is to figure out the algorithm to create that array. The prompt will be of the form "How to create...", where... is an integer between 2 and 10, inclusive. The solution will be the creation of a list of 12 integers starting with 2.<n><n>### Solution:<n>```<n>function createArray(num){<n>  let arrayOfNumbers=[]<n>  let lastNumber=0<n>  for(let i=num;i<lastNumber+5;i++){<n>    arrayOfNumbers.push(i)<n>  }<n>  return console.log(arrayOfNumbers)<n>}<n><n>let input = prompt("Let us know how to create...")<n><n>createArray(input)<n>```<n><n>```<n>The prompt we created will be (4). How to create [2, 6, 10]? <n><n>So the algorithm involves doing while loop for all the numbers from the last <n><n>Number that we have in the Array to the last <n><n>and put the numbers in between to the array<n>```<n><n>## Instructions<n>Input:The numbers on the first roll of the die are 6,7,1,1,5. So, from 4:00 PM you can deduce which is between 10am- midnight, so the flight will arrive at 11am.<n><n>### Input <n>One person is in jail and the warden is holding one egg, and two pistols, in order to let him out, he has to unlock the door but he can only hold one pistol and one egg at the same time, how can he get out immediately? Choices:  A: cash drawer B: piggy bank C: purse D: box E: pocket<n><n>### Response:		C<n><n>### Explanation:A cash drawer is used to put money into it, not to take money out of it. A purse is what they are referring to when they say "pocket". A pocket would be something someone can open, it's not necessarily hidden away in another bag. In order for a dollar to not be able to be taken out of, it would have to be in the box and a safe. The box is referring to a person. If they are locked in a box and a safe they will not be able to take any money out.<n><n>### Input:-32 & 64<n><n>### Response:-32<n><n>### Explantion:64-32=32<n><n>##Instructions:<n>In this task you will follow written and verbal instructions and complete a set of actions. You begin work 4.5 hours after you start work.<n><n>### Explantion:<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the questions with yes or no. I give feedback of a specific mistake,  `A. tennis elbow  could not relate to  the question."`.<n><n>This solution is different from that of a teacher.<n><n>A teacher:<n>1. E - many addicts turn to exercisen to detox.<n><n>### Input :A man can get from a certain town to two nearby towns with total cost equal to.15 times the distance between them.How much does a car service cost?.<n><n>### Response<n><n>A- A Man can get to 6 town, from the Town C with cost of 10, From Town C to town A can be reached with cost of 15 and Town A to town C with cost of 30; Thereby, It works out.15 times 10 +.15 times 15 +.15(15+30) = 103,thus, Car service Cost is of 103$<n><n><n>### Input<n>"1. A man can get from a place C to 6 towns with total cost equal.15 times the _____ between them.<n><n>2. The two towns D and E are _____ apart as A is from B.<n><n>3. The two towns F and G are _____ apart as C is from B.<n>"<n><n>### Response :<n><n><n>|1|3|<n>|5|1|<n><n><n>###  Input:<n>"A man can get from B to 3 towns with total cost equal 0.2A + 0.2B + 0.4E.<n><n>If the man takes route A, then he can get to H in 3 times the time it takes to get from C to D.<n><n>C to D is ___ times the distance from B to C as the distance C to D is ___.<n><n>On route B-H, if the speed of a bus or car is 2.5 times as fast, then it takes 3 times as long to travel".<n><n><n>### Response <n><n><n>|3|2.5|1|1.5|2|3|<n>|1|1|3|2|<n><n><n>## Task<n><n>Write 5 task requests following the instructions provided in the table above. Your list's elements should be numbers, their positions should be read as strings, and their representations should be written as string. For example, with the following input:<n><n>```<n>6 0 1 23 3344<n>```<n><n>your code should produce the following result:<n><n>```<n>[6,0,1,10003344]<n>```<n><n>### Notes on the example input/output<n>The first number is the position of the element in your list. The second number is the digit in which your digit resides. The last two numbers are the digits themselves, as well as their positions in the number.<n><n>### HINTS and Notes about input/output format<n>- Your input string looks like:<n>```<n>6 6 0 0 1 1 2 1000 3 3 4 4 <n>```<n>- Each digit is 3 digits long, one number. The position of each digit resides in its corresponding pair of digit numbers next to that digit.<n>- For example, the 6th digit resides in the pair [6, 6] since it is the 6th digit.<n>- The first digit is in a different pair, however, it resides in the first position [6, 0]. In both cases, the numbers are in the position of the digit, which is in the list in that same position.<n><n>### Your task:<n><n>Write code that creates a list and reads from stdin in the above form of input until it reaches the number 5000, meaning that there are 5000 digits in your list.<n><n>### You will be tested on the following:<n>- You need to read the string until it either:<n>  - Becomes the digit 5001<n>  - Reaches the number of iterations

If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. They work for four hours and are then joined by 6 other people who also work at the same rate. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>Input: Jodi starts off walking 1 mile a day for 6 days a week.  On the second week, she walks 2 miles a day, 6 days a week.  On the third week, she walks 3 miles a day, 6 days a week. Finally on the fourth week, she walks 4 miles a day, 6 days a week.  How many miles has she walked in 4 weeks?<n>Answer: 60<n><n>Input: A club is going to get additional members so that they will have 5 more than twice their current number of their members. If the club has 10 members now, how many additional members do they need?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>### Input:If one sees a fox and is standing in a landlocked, southern state, where is this person? Choices:  A: expect to die B: believe in god C: stay in D: watch movies E: eat corn<n><n>### Response:		I will stay in, because I have to finish a book project.<n><n>### Input Choices:  A. 5% of adults B. 75% of adults C. 15% of adults D. 95% of adults E. 5% of children<n><n>### Response 1: I will stay in.<n><n>### Response Choice 2: I will go to the movies, because I have to watch a film before school tomorrow.<n><n>### Output:105.5<n><n>### Explanation: We multiply the percent of adults by the population of adults in the United States: 100*5 = 500. We can round 500 to 550. We round all numbers to one decimal place. We multiply 550 children by 1(children are 5%) to get 27.5. We multiply 27.5 adults by 0.5(adults are 15%) to get 13.75. We add the numbers to get total. 550 +13.75 = 663.75. 663.57 is closest to 663.25<n><n>### Instructions: Answer the following multiple choice question:<n><n>### Instructon:What has a head, arms, body, and legs but can't walk?<n><n>### Demostration<n>Choices:<n>A. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. They work for four hours and are then joined by 6 other people who also work at the same rate. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>Input: Jodi starts off walking 1 mile a day for 6 days a week.  On the second week, she walks 2 miles a day, 6 days a week.  On the third week, she walks 3 miles a day, 6 days a week. Finally on the fourth week, she walks 4 miles a day, 6 days a week.  How many miles has she walked in 4 weeks?<n>Answer: 60<n><n>Input: A club is going to get additional members so that they will have 5 more than twice their current number of their members. If the club has 10 members now, how many additional members do they need?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>### Input:Where can the legs of a stool be built? Choices:  A: jail B: internet cafe C: blacksmith's shop D: building E: bar<n><n>### Response:		C<n>jail<n><n>### Instructions:In this problem, we will have a list of numbers and we will be asked to choose all the even numbers.<n><n>### Input :[2,2,3,5,5,11,7,9,11,11]<n><n>### Output:Even Numbers: 2, 4, 6, 8, 10<n><n><n>### Input:[1,1,2,5,7,101,7,6,8]<n><n>### Response :Even Numbers : 2,4,6,8,10,101,8<n><n>### Instuctions: This is a sequence for a program. Using the sequence. Write a program in JavaScript that prints the sequence out. Your program must accept an integer n. And then print the sequence out for that n using for loops and string concatenation.<n>```<n>Sequence : 1 3 8 19 51<n>1: print the number 1<n>2: print 3<n>```<n><n>### Instutions : This problem is about the sequence for a program for a sequence. Write a program that prints the sequence below using for loops and string concatoranation<n>```<n>Sequence :1 2 3 4<n>1: print 1<n>2: Print 2<n>3: Print 3<n>4: print 4.<n>```}

One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. They work for four hours and are then joined by 6 other people who also work at the same rate. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>Input: Jodi starts off walking 1 mile a day for 6 days a week.  On the second week, she walks 2 miles a day, 6 days a week.  On the third week, she walks 3 miles a day, 6 days a week. Finally on the fourth week, she walks 4 miles a day, 6 days a week.  How many miles has she walked in 4 weeks?<n>Answer: 60<n><n>Input: A club is going to get additional members so that they will have 5 more than twice their current number of their members. If the club has 10 members now, how many additional members do they need?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>### Input:What are students trying to do? Choices:  A: study philosophy B: become adult C: ask questions D: further education E: study together<n><n>### Response:		What has students studying? Choices:  philosophy A: adult B: questions C: education D: together<n><n>### Input :What are students trying to understand? Choices:  a: philosophy B: adult C: questions D: education E: together<n><n>###### Response:<n>Choices:A: study a philosophy / B: study together / C: understand what are students studying / D: understand who are the members<n><n>### Input<n>What is the purpose of the club described below?<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following multiple-choice question.<n><n>###### Choices:<n>Choices:<n><n>- [A](#tellme) To study philosophy<n>- [B](#tellme) to study together<n>- [C](#tellme) For ask questions<n>- [D](#tellme) for further your studies<n>- [E](#tellme) study education  <n><n>---<n>### Input<n><n>### Instructiuons:Write a response that appropriately begins the task.<n><n>### Choices:<n><n>Choices:<n>- [A](#askme)  What's your studying?<n>- [B](#askme)  Why are you studying philosophy?<n>- [C](#askme)  When will we begin studying together?<n>- [D](#askme)  Do we have to understand what are you studying before we join this club?<n>- [E](#askme)  Would you like to study together for education?<n>- [F](#askme)  Whereabouts?<n>---<n>

Choices:  A: necklace B: wall outlet fixture C: tool box D: computer E: motorcycle<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>    if (typeof chainRing!=='string') {<n>        alert('Chain ring is a string!');<n>    } else if (chainRing === '') {<n>        alert('You didn\'t enter anything!');<n>    }<n><n>### Input:(What is the last letter of the alphabet?) Choices: A: B: C: D: E<n><n>### Response:(The last letter of the alphabet is Z)<n><n>    prompt('Please enter a letter.', (answer) => {<n>        if (typeof answer!=='string') {alert('The input was not a string!');}<n>        else if (answer === '') {<n>            alert('Enter something!')<n>        }<n>        else if ( answer >= 'L' && answer <= 'Z') {<n>            alert('The last letter is '+answer);<n>        }<n>        }<n>    )<n>### Input:(How would you use a jolt box?) Choice A: To store energy by plugging your phone in Choice B: To unplug items Choice C: To store energy Choice D: To recharge your phone Choice A or Choice B <n><n>### Response A:<n><n>    prompt('You can also use your outlet box to plug-in your phone! Do you?', (answer) =>{<n>        if (typeof outletBox!=='string' || outletBox === '') alert('PLEASE ENTER A CHOICE!')<n>        else if (outletBox === 'A') {<n>            alert( 'Awesome! You are using this box to charge your phone!')<n>        } else if (outletbox === 'B') {<n>            alert("This box is an outlet box, so it cannot recharge your phone. You are not using this outlet box!')<n>        }   <n>    }<n>    );<n><n>### Input(What is the capital of Algeria?) Option D is correct if you are using the sword to display inside your house, because "scabbard" is both a container and a weapon.<n><n>### Input :What was the name of the first space shuttle? Choices: 1. Enterprise 2. Columbia 3. Discovery 4. Atlantis 5. Challenger 6. Endeavour<n><n>### Response :<n>Option 5 is incorrect. The shuttle didn't have a name at the time it launched, although it was given one after the disaster at launch.<n><n>### Question:<n>The number of people who are able to correctly calculate the following equation is 4.<n><n>$3x^3 (2x + 3 ) = 64 x^2 $<n><n>Which of the following is the maximum number of additional people able to correctly calculate the same equation?<n><n>### Options:<n>#### Option A<n><n>#### Option B<n><n><n>### Response<n><n>4 + 6 - 1 = 9 people.<n><n>### Task 1<n>Given a table, find the product and the sum of the table.<n><n>**Example 1**<n><n>Table<n><n>Given table 22, we found that the product of the table 22 is 48 and the sum of the 22 is 122.<n><n><n>**Example 2**<n><n>Table<n>Table 30, product is 420 and the sum is 1580.<n><n>### Notes:<n><n>Notes: The answer must be accurate.<n><n>### Output:<n><n>Answer: The answer must be the same as the number above each choice.<n><n>### Construct:<n><n>Construct: To create the table for the question, you have to use the formula `row\times\column`. Please see example 3 for more details.<n><n>### Examples:<n><n>Example 1: 5\*2 = 10<n><n>Example 2: 6\*5 = 30<n><n>Example 3: 2\*6 = 12<n><n>Example 4: 1\*10 = 10<n>

Choices:  A: new york B: whorehouse C: street corner D: corner of two streets E: brother<n><n>### Response:		D<n><n>### Question 1:<n>Because the nuts (3 kilograms) and the dried fruits (2.5 kilogram) costs $18 and $8 respectively. 56 = 2.5 kilogram x $8 + (2.5/3) kilogram x $12<n><n>### Question2:<n>The total time spent exercising is 4 hours, considering the 30% of time spent doing both warm-ups and warming up is:<n><n>4 x (1/3) = 1.33 hours<n><n>The total time spent in exercise is: 4 x 0.7 = 2.8<n><n>### Question3:<n>Price before: `200 x (20/100) = 100`<n><n>Price after: `100 x 1.2 = 120`<n><n>### Question4:<n>The number of goals scored by each player is `(300/2) = 150`<n><n>## Question5:<n>The total fluid consumed in the week is 868 x (5/7) = 96 ounces<n><n>### Question6:<n>The number of hours it takes to fill the truck is `3600/6 = 60`<n><n>## # Question7:<n>The total number of cups of liquids drank by the two boys is `(18+18)` cups.<n><n>### Question8:<n>Each shipping box contains 300 widgets<n><n>### Question9:<n>The total money received in 5 days with 2 hours overtime is: `(150 x 4 + 5 x 3 x 1.5) = 820`<n><n><n>### Question10:<n>The number of miles the woman walked is: (28 + 36 + 32 + 19 + 12) / 6 = 26 miles.<n><n>### Qustion11:<n>The number of additional members they need is: `5 x (2 + 1) = 15.`<n>

Choices:  A: matchwinning B: cash in C: compete D: return E: celebrate<n><n>### Response:		**A:MatchWinning**<n>### Explanation:<n>The gambler has won a lot so he wants to continue winning so he may not want to withdraw the money and spend it on celebration.<n><n>### Input : The gambler had been losing for a while, he wisely decided what?<n><n>### Choices :   A: to withdraw B: to compete C: celebrate D: return E: matchwinning<n><n>### Response   : E: Matchwinning<n>### Explanatino :  <n><n>The gambler had lost for a while so there gambler decided to remain there and won back his money.<n><n><n>I don't know how to use the ifelsion and else condition so i am doing so with other way of writing.<n>### Instruction 1: There is a restaurant that just opened. One bowl of soup costs $4. A sandwich costs $7 so a combination bowl of soup and sandwich costs $11. A sandwich with soup costs $16. How much does a bowl of the soup cost?<n>### Instruction : <n>### Demonstraion :<n><n>1)Soup = 11$<n>2)Soup (sandwich+$7)=11+7=18$<n>3)2/ 3x18=24.665$<n>4)Round:25$<n><n>### Instrucion 2: A book that costs $18 and that has 1000 pages is on sale for $16. If the book costs $4 more than three times its number of pages, how many pages is it?<n>### Instructions  :<n><n>1)1000=18/3x3$<n>2)1000/3$=1000/6$=100<n><n>### Instutructuon 3: What number is 10% of 155?<n><n>### Instuituction 4: What is 20% of 220?<n><n>### INstruction 5 : How many gallons are there in 90 litres?<n><n>###Instruction 6 : 105% of 100 would be what?<n><n>##Inst

Use variables to represent the two tasks.<n>Answer:<n>The variable "X" represents a unit of time and the variable "Y" represents the two tasks.<n><n>The time in terms of our variables is:<n>X.Y<n>So<n>X.Y = 6<n><n>#### Instructions-<n>Give a complete, appropriately complete response to the questions.<n><n>### Inpu-<n>What would you say was an advantage to using a telescope in a battle?  <n><n>- Response:<n>- Using a telescope would have been an advantage. You would get a better look of things.<n><n>### Input Question-<n>What might have been one disadvantage of using your telescope in a battle that involved people?  <n>- Response:<n>The disadvantage of using the telescope in a battle involving people would involve the light that is reflected from it. I would guess that other people may have been able to fight through that light to get to me.<n><n><n><n>##### 2.6, 1.1<n>---------------------------<n>#### 2.6. 1.1<n><n><n>### Instructions-<n>Below is a task. Choices:  A: cash register B: desk drawer C: pay envelope D: throw away E: box<n><n>### Response:		<n>- Answer: A<n>(<n><input value="A"><n>)<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Choose the statement that matches the pattern.<n>- How many people is the company supposed to hire? Choices: <n><n>### Demostration:<n><n>### Input<n>- Every week the supermarket needs to make sure they have enough can openers to stock all their shelves.  The number of can openers they are suppose to <n>have is 100 % of any week's sales in the previous week.<n><n>### Response<n><n>### Input 2<n>- A carnival is having a fundraiser to raise money for kids.  To increase the number of people attending the carnival, they are selling tickets <n>for 15 dollars each, and each child under 10 is free.<n><n>### Demo 2<n><n>### Input3<n>- The town council is having a celebration for the opening of a new school.  To encourage people to come, they are holding a dance 1/3 of the way<n>through the celebration. Adults can get in for 5 dollars and kids for 1.50 <n><n>###Demo 3<n><n><n>### Input4<n>- A music festival has two stages. He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>Input: Jodi starts off walking 1 mile a day for 6 days a week.  On the second week, she walks 2 miles a day, 6 days a week.  On the third week, she walks 3 miles a day, 6 days a week. Finally on the fourth week, she walks 4 miles a day, 6 days a week.  How many miles has she walked in 4 weeks?<n>Answer: 60<n><n>Input: A club is going to get additional members so that they will have 5 more than twice their current number of their members. If the club has 10 members now, how many additional members do they need?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>### Input:What is love when everyone keeps feeling it? Choices:  A: contagious B: wrong C: last forever D: painful E: blind<n><n>### Response:		Answer choice D<n><n>---<n><n>## Task:<n>## [Instruction:Answer the following question.<n><n>## Task: <n>Use your knowledge of basic arithmetic to correctly fill in the blank.<n><n><n>Solve the problem: a boy named Bob is 12 years old. How many years older is Bob's dad?<n><n>Answer:<n><n>Bob is 24 years old. Bob's dad has 12 years' worth of age over Bob: 36-12=24, or Bob's dad is _____ years older than Bob ____.<n><n>## Instruction:Four employees work for A-P-U Foods, and they're paid their wages semi-monthly. These are their semi-monthly salaries: <n><n>Mike—$13,000 ($533 per week) <n><n>Caroline—$12,000 ($483 per week)  <--------------------- <n><n>Lisa—$12,500 ($441 per week) <n>-----------------------<n><n>Gordon—$13,500 ($509 per week) <n>What total does these four people's wages amount to?<n><n>---<n><n><n>Use your knowledge of elementary mathematics to fill in the blank. The problem is as follows:<n><n>Ronald took a five-mile hike. Afterwards, he had a two mile drive home. What is the total distance Ronald traveled?<n><n>---<n>

He felt that he'd ruin his relationship with Jen if he took it further, and he didn't want to do that.  At the same time,  He fight that pushing farther might do what to something good? Choices:  A: found B: destroy C: construct D: fix E: produce<n><n>### Response:		<n>E<n><n>### Instructions:Find the odd number out.<n><n>### Input<n>3+1,2-7,9/2,15 - 12<n>Output:7<n><n>### Input and Output:53<54,21<48<n>Output:false<n><n>### Instructons:find the odd number in a sequence<n><n>### Input1,6,1025<n>Output:6<n><n>### The rule is:if the number is ODD, the sequence continues;if the number is EVEN, the sequence ends<n><n>### Input8,1813<n>Output:18<n><n>## Acknowledgements<n><n>* This problem is inspired by the book Programming interviews Explorations : An Insider's Guide by John P. Choices:  A: music store B: orchestra C: jazz band D: rock band E: music studio<n><n>### Response:		The answer I choose is B.<n><n>### Input 9:How do you make it 20 + 10 + 20 + 3 + 40? Choice: A: Add 10 to 40 (40 + 10). B: Multiply by 3 (40 * 3). C: Subtract 10 from 40 (49-10). D: Subtract 3 from 40 (39-3).<n><n>### Response 9:I should subtract 3 from 49.<n><n>### [39-3](https://www.dropbox.com/s/r0jy206317zrjz1/39-3.JPG?dl=0)<n><n><n><n><n>### Input A:When Adam buys 100 tiles, he pays $25 dollars more than for 10 tiles. How many tiles does he buy?<n>Answer: 90<n><n>### [Adam buys 10 tiles for $100, 30 tiles for $250 and 60 tiles for $500. So he bought 130 tiles.  His total cost for 130 tils is $250 + 300 + 500 = $449 + 20% so his total cost is $542.]<n><n><n><n>##Input B: A truck driver earns $18 dollars for driving 110 miles (km). For each additional 10 kilometers he drives, he receives a bonus equal to $7 dollars. How much extra money does he earn by driving 900 kilometers?<n>Answer: +160 dollars<n><n>##Answer A: I can earn 24 dollars per 222 kilometers if i get $12 dollars for every 110 km and he gets a $7 dollars for each 10 km.  So the total cost I pay for 1333 km is $124.<n><n><n><n>##Answer B: The total cost is $124 dollars plus $160.  so total cost of 1333 kilometers is $284 dollars.<n>

How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>Input: Jodi starts off walking 1 mile a day for 6 days a week. Choices:  A: believe in god B: sun themselves C: eat hamburgers D: gain wealth E: eat plants<n><n>### Response:		All vegetarians eat plants (E). The other choices assume that their behavior in them is identical,  but there is no reason to assume that.<n><n>### InputIf a person has the maximum number of pets, they also have the maximum number of cats. If they have the maximum number of pigeons, they have the minimum number of fish.   Choices B: Have no animals C: Have three pigeons. D: Have six fish E: Have five pets <n><n>### ResponseThe only choice that works is C: Have three pets.<n><n>### If all dogs are pigeons, which is false? Therefore the maximum number of fish must be 1?  Choices False (I) A: three B: seven C: one E: six <n><n>### FalseBecause the only other answer is 3 fish, but that would violate the condition. But that makes the question ambiguous.<n><n>### A man will be more likely to win if he has more games experience, if he has more games coaching experience, or if he has more games played as a starting player? Choices:  A: tree tops B: rain forest C: zoological gardens D: great outdoors E: zoo<n><n>### Response:		A: tree tops<n><n>### Instructions:<n>In the previous programming problem you were instructed to find the result of a multiplication, addition, division, and subtraction of whole numbers.  In this problem you'll learn to select the appropriate statement to complete the equation.<n><n>### Sample response:<n>Question: Find the product of 2 and 4, where the product is:<n><n>A.16<n><n>B.47<n><n>C.98<n><n>### Sample answer:<n>The multiplication formula is "2 x 4 = 8"<n><n>### Solution:<n>2 ⋅ 4 = 8<n><n>### Instinctive questions:<n>Question: Find an array a = 7, 8, 9, 2, 2, 9, 0, 1 where:<n><n>A. The value of a and the subscript number value are all the same number<n><n>B. The value of a is smaller than its subscript number<n><n>### Answer:<n>A. The value and subscript number value are not equal.  For example, the value and subscript are both: 5 ⋅ 3 = 1<n><n>### Solution description:<n>The multiplication formula for an array is "a[n] x a[m]", where n and m represent the subscript number of that item in the array.<n><n>### Tutorial question:<n>Question: Find a sum where given the variable:<n>A.5 + 8 ⋅ - 9<n><n>B.The value of the variable is a positive whole number that is less than 12.<n><n>### Answer and Solution:<n>A. The sum is 5 + (-9) = -4. -4 is a negative number.<n><n>### Subtraction:<n>Question: -25 - 5 - 4 = ___.<n><n>### Answer to subtraction:<n>A. 25 + 5 - 4 - 4<n><n>B.3<n><n>### Solution to subtraction: <n>"25" and "-25" are both positive numbers, they would be less if they were negative (25 + (-25) = 50). 5 and 4 are both negative numbers, the sum is 4 less than the negative number.  The sum of negative numbers is a

Choices:  A: opened B: closed C: found at shower D: falling down E: locked<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>A, The bedroom door was closed.

How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>Input: Jodi starts off walking 1 mile a day for 6 days a week.  On the second week, she walks 2 miles a day, 6 days a week.  On the third week, she walks 3 miles a day, 6 days a week. Finally on the fourth week, she walks 4 miles a day, 6 days a week.  How many miles has she walked in 4 weeks?<n>Answer: 60<n><n>Input: A club is going to get additional members so that they will have 5 more than twice their current number of their members. If the club has 10 members now, how many additional members do they need?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>### Input:The disease was spreading fast, so what were researchers desperately seeking? Choices:  A: cause spots on leaf B: healthy C: wellness D: ball stopped E: cure<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>The disease was spreading and thus what the researchers were desperately seeking is a cure.<n><n>The answer is 'healthy' [E]. 'Ball stopped' is not correct since it is not about health, but about the disease that is spreading.<n>'A: cause spots on leaves' [A] is correct since spots on leaf means the disease is spreading, and further research is needed to find a cure.<n>'C: wellness' [C] is incorrect because it is not about the disease, but about the research. When researching, they are looking for a cure for the spreading disease.<n>'D: ball stopped' [D] is incorrect since it is not about the spreading disease. It is only about the disease.<n><n>We can conclude that the correct answer is 'E: cause spots on the leaves' [E].<n><n>

On the 5th day of the marathon, they each ran 50 miles and their grand total accumulated mileage is 100 miles.  John runs twice as far as Bob.  On the 6th day of the marahton, each man ran their respective miles. How many miles did Bob run on day 6?<n><n>### The price for two movie tickets is $200.  Twice the price for one movie ticket is $370.  What price is one movie ticket?<n><n>#### Addition:<n>One movie ticket is $12.50.<n><n>#### Subtraction:<n>Twice the price for each movie ticket is $25.<n><n>### A woman makes $30 a day working part-time. If she works for 5 weeks, how much money is she owed?<n><n>#### Multiplication:<n>She is owed $150.<n><n>## Coding:<n>### Code your output from each questions<n>### A company paid $4

She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>Input: Jodi starts off walking 1 mile a day for 6 days a week.  On the second week, she walks 2 miles a day, 6 days a week.  On the third week, she walks 3 miles a day, 6 days a week. Finally on the fourth week, she walks 4 miles a day, 6 days a week.  How many miles has she walked in 4 weeks?<n>Answer: 60<n><n>Input: A club is going to get additional members so that they will have 5 more than twice their current number of their members. If the club has 10 members now, how many additional members do they need?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>### Input:Where can you buy a fishing rod? Choices:  A: furniture store B: fishing camp C: hardware store D: sporting goods store E: engine<n><n>### Response:		C<n><n>The hardware store is for tools. The furniture store is for house things. The fishing camp is for fishers. The sporting goods store is for sports. (engine doesn't make any sense so doesn't count.)<n><n>### Input <n><n>The number of goals scored in all games last season that included a team from Barcelona accounted for 20%<n><n>### Question <n><n>How many games were there?<n><n>### Multiple Choice Response<n><n>165 games<n><n>### Input<n><n>Every day, Katie makes 6 eggs for her husband for breakfast.<n><n>### Question<n><n>How many eggs does their refrigerator have?<n><n>### Response<n><n>30<n><n>### Input (Answer)<n><n>Kenny has a car that gets 20 mpg.<n>He drives 1,500 miles over this road trip.<n>He filled the car once before, for an extra trip.<n>The trip also included an off-roading adventure.<n><n>### Task<n><n>Round to the nearest penny how much gas does he spend in total?<n><n>### Answer<n><n>**42.**<n><n>### Input/Question/Response<n><n>Sheila spent $95 at the candy store. Twinkle Spinelli spent $125 at the toy store. How much money did the stores make from their joint purchases? Choices A: Sheila bought more candy B: Twinkle spent more money C: Both D: neither E: Twinkle bought more toys<n><n><n>### Task 2.<n><n><n>### Input.<n><n><n>## Task 2:<n><n>### Input & Question:<n>Answers: [359](../Assets/InputPairs/Task2_Question_Sample5x7_Input5_Answer359.png) [387](../Assets/OutputPairs/Task2Final/387.png) [364](../Assets/inputPairs/task2question5by7_input364.png)<n><n><n>### Multiple choice answers<n><n><n>### Question: <n>Answers: 690 <n><n>### Input-Output: <n>3609<n><n>### Input Pairs

He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. If the club has 10 members now, how many additional members do they need?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>### Input:The helm is not something you wear on your head. Rather, it moves the masts on what? Choices:  A: sailing vessel B: paddleboat C: ship D: motorboat E: tugboat<n><n>### Response:		<n>The helm controls the rudder on a sailing vessel. There is also a helm for controlling the propeller and steering on motorboats and a similar setup on a tug boat, however they are only used when under propulsion. A paddleboat does not use a helm at all, and a ship does not have such a device.<n><n>---<n><n>###### Original Author: [Denis Kravets](https://www.linkedin.com/in/deniskravets/), [Mike Wang](https://www.mikewang.info), [Ryan Lackey](https://www.ryanlackey.me), and<n>[Maria Shifren](https://www.maria.shifren.us).<n>

The income is doubled and all the money is spent to purchase two things, one of them being a computer. The other thing can be anything. If the person earns $146 per week, how many weeks will the person need to save so that he or she will be able to buy both things?<n># Input: A: A person’s weekly income is in $146. The person needs to save the money to buy a computer and something else.<n># Solution:<n># A person’s income should be $146.<n>#  The person should double this income.<n>#  The income should be spent on a computer and something

How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>Input: Jodi starts off walking 1 mile a day for 6 days a week.  On the second week, she walks 2 miles a day, 6 days a week.  On the third week, she walks 3 miles a day, 6 days a week. Finally on the fourth week, she walks 4 miles a day, 6 days a week.  How many miles has she walked in 4 weeks?<n>Answer: 60<n><n>Input: A club is going to get additional members so that they will have 5 more than twice their current number of their members. In the following multiple choice and matching questions, the lettered choices are all incorrect. Select the lettered choice that most appropriately completes the task. In the following multiple matching, lettered choices that are not correct or that are wrongly listed are to be shaded in bold. Choose the one that will best complete the task and remove the others so that the task is satisfied.<n><n><n>---<n>**Question:** A 6-foot-3-inch man can put a basketball perfectly through a 10-foot net or a 6-foot-high basket in a room with a ceiling height of 8.5 feet. He can also shoot a 4-foot jump shot perfectly through a 1-foot hoop, and his shoe size is size 14. How tall is the basketball goal in the room?<n><n><n>### _  <n>#### A <n>---<n><n><n>### Instructor Note:<n>*<n>* Write the student response here:<n>*<n><n>---<n>**Multiple choice:** Select the correct answer from the list given.<n>*<n>* Write here:<n><n>---<n><n>### Matching<n>#### Multiple matching<n>*<n>

How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>Input: Jodi starts off walking 1 mile a day for 6 days a week.  On the second week, she walks 2 miles a day, 6 days a week.  On the third week, she walks 3 miles a day, 6 days a week. Finally on the fourth week, she walks 4 miles a day, 6 days a week.  How many miles has she walked in 4 weeks?<n>Answer: 60<n><n>Input: A club is going to get additional members so that they will have 5 more than twice their current number of their members. If the club has 10 members now, how many additional members do they need?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>### Input:If someone is outgoing what are they likely to seek? Choices:  A: new experiences B: playfulness C: own house D: good looking E: beautiful<n><n>### Response:		<n>### Demonstation:<n>Input: A is incorrect because outgoing people will generally tend to seek social and good relationships, especially on a social media platform.<n><n>### Solution:<n>Input: B is incorrect because an outgoing person will tend to be extroverted.<n>A typical answer to a problem like this is to make a formula or algorithm for computing the solution. On the second week, she walks 2 miles a day, 6 days a week.  On the third week, she walks 3 miles a day, 6 days a week. Finally on the fourth week, she walks 4 miles a day, 6 days a week.  How many miles has she walked in 4 weeks?<n>Answer: 60<n><n>Input: A club is going to get additional members so that they will have 5 more than twice their current number of their members. One factor is each persons earnings, and the other four factors are population, inflation, taxes, and average annual expenditures, in decreasing order of importance. The population is 500,000 people, and the taxes are 300,009 dollars as well as the inflation. The output is the total amount of money in the state.<n>

Choices: A: in the hospital B: at work C: at home D: at the coffee shop E: walking<n><n>### Response:"at home"<n><n>### Input:"A group of friends from 5 different countries go out for lunch. There are some math enthusiasts at the table, and want to find out how much money they spent on lunch. 1.) Their total lunch budget is $90, 2.) Each person in the group ordered different kinds of food. 3.) Every person from a different country ordered food from a different restaurant. How much did each individual person spend on food?"<n><n>### Response:[Given: "In total, each person spent $10, and the total amount of food they ordered is $88."] Each person individually spent a total of at most $10. If the total of food ordered is $88, then each one spent a total of $8.80 on their meal.<n><n>### Input"What happens if two people decide to buy the same exact car?" (If you answer incorrectly, please explain the reasoning for the incorrect answer.)<n><n>### Response"The car costs $200,000?"<n><n>### Input "If one of the players from the previous problems had broken his leg, then he/she would not have scored the goal.  Thus, the game in those circumstances would have been 1:0."<n><n>### Response "[Given: "If the two players had scored even" - Score] Then the answer is 1 answer: 0.5 * Score.  We know that they scored half of the total number of goals in the league last season.  Therefore we can say that the total amount of goals scored in the last season from the two players is half the total amount of goals that scored in the last season by exactly two players.  We use this to calculate the first one player's goal count."<n>

One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. They work for four hours and are then joined by 6 other people who also work at the same rate. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>Input: Jodi starts off walking 1 mile a day for 6 days a week.  On the second week, she walks 2 miles a day, 6 days a week.  On the third week, she walks 3 miles a day, 6 days a week. Finally on the fourth week, she walks 4 miles a day, 6 days a week.  How many miles has she walked in 4 weeks?<n>Answer: 60<n><n>Input: A club is going to get additional members so that they will have 5 more than twice their current number of their members. If the club has 10 members now, how many additional members do they need?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>### Input:James used the cannon to shoot at something while seeking lunch. It was overkill.  What did he shoot at? Choices:  A: body armor B: ungulate C: bomber D: kill people E: animal<n><n>### Response:		Answer B<n><n>### Input:\Bert works for PBS. Choices:  A: birds B: action C: butterflies D: happiness E: anxiety<n><n>### Response:		C<n><n>### Input<n>Input: You are at Lulu land. You want to know how many pins you will have left if you take 100+5 pins from a collection that starts with 2332332 pins. How many?<n><n>Input: What is the name of the capital of the United States?<n><n>Input: You start at point A and go 700 yards west until you reach point B, another is 450 yards north from point A. What is point B?<n><n>Input: From A to point a is 15 1/10. How many 1/10 is that?<n><n>Input: I'm from point A to point B along the 31st parallel. How long is that?<n><n>### Response<n>A: 7075/10 B: 2065/10 A: 200 yards B: the 0 degrees latitude C: 12.5 D:155 miles<n><n>### Answer<n><n>* [![1631442327992](https://s3.amazonaws.com/codecamp-assets/codecamp.svg)](https://www.codecademy.com/cryptic_sandwich" target="_top")(View on Codecademy)<n>### Solution:<n>```python<n>import string<n>input = ["point B.", "pollinaters","United" "York", "the" "parallel"]<n>#print(input)<n>words = [word.split() for word in input]<n>#print(*words, sep ='')<n><n>for word in words:<n>    key = []<n>    key+= word[0]<n>    for letter in word[1:]:<n>        key += letter<n>    print(''+ key.upper() +'is a ', key.capitalize(),' ')<n>```<n>### Questions:<n>* What is the value of the variable key?<n>* Explain how it would be possible to write that algorithm.<n>### Answer:<n>```Python<n>key = []<n>key+= word[0] #A<n>for letter in word[1:] #B<n>    key += letter #C<n><n>key = word.split()<n>key<n>[u'point B.']<n>[u

Choices:  A: fun B: talent C: learn about D: intelligence E: recognize<n><n>### Response:		<n>```python<n>class Solution:<n>    def solve(self):<n>        return 3<n>```<n>- A: fun - 1<n><n>- B: talent - 2<n><n>- C: learn about - 3<n><n>- D: intelligence - 4<n><n>- E: recognize - 5<n><n>- A or D - I like A the most<n><n>- B or A - I like A the more<n><n>- C or D - I like B the more<n><n>- D or E - I like E the more<n><n>### Input<n>```js<n>[<n>  {<n>    "type": "input",<n>    "title": "Difference",<n>    "name": "difference",<n>    "label": "The difference between 12 and 18 is?"<n>  },<n>  {<n>    $: {<n>      "title": "Multiple",<n>      "name": "multiple",<n>      "label": "The multiple of 18 and 2 is?"<n>    }<n>  }<n>]<n>```<n><n>### Output<n>```js<n>[ {<n>    type: "choice",<n>    name: "16",<n>    label: "The difference between 21 and 28 is 16."<n>  }, {<n>    type: 'choice',<n>    name: '24',<n>    label: 'The multiple of 21 and 4 is 24'<n>  }<n>]  <n>```<n>- type: 'choice' 16 & 24<n>- name: '16', '24'<n>- label: 'The difference between 2 and 28 is  16.'  +" The multiple of 2 and 4 is  24.'"<n><n>### Instructions<n><n>Write a program that provides the requested information.<n><n>### Input a number:<n>```<n>number = 2<n>```<n><n>## Input:<n>```js<n>[ [ 'type' ] ]<n>```<n><n>Output:<n>```js<n>{ type: 'question' }<n>```<n><n>## Answer<n>```js<n>[ 'number' ]<n>```<n>

If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. They work for four hours and are then joined by 6 other people who also work at the same rate. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>Input: Jodi starts off walking 1 mile a day for 6 days a week.  On the second week, she walks 2 miles a day, 6 days a week.  On the third week, she walks 3 miles a day, 6 days a week. Finally on the fourth week, she walks 4 miles a day, 6 days a week.  How many miles has she walked in 4 weeks?<n>Answer: 60<n><n>Input: A club is going to get additional members so that they will have 5 more than twice their current number of their members. If the club has 10 members now, how many additional members do they need?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>### Input:Dave put his beer where he could get to it, but it would be off the floor.  Where did he put it? Choices:  A: refrigerator B: closet C: can D: shelf E: soccer game<n><n>### Response:		I'd say he put it on his shelf because that's where he could get to, and it is off the floor. He can't put it in the refrigerator because it's too cold. He can't use a can because it's too soft for that position. He can't place it on the ground because it's hard for Dave to reach that position. Also, he cannot place it behind a cabinet. If he wants a beer, he will need to pull it out of the cabinet.<n><n>I think we should have used C instead A because it is not off the floor. C refers to cabinets where A shows refrigerator. If he wants refrigerator, then it is A but he was trying to save the beer.

How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>Input: Jodi starts off walking 1 mile a day for 6 days a week.  On the second week, she walks 2 miles a day, 6 days a week.  On the third week, she walks 3 miles a day, 6 days a week. Finally on the fourth week, she walks 4 miles a day, 6 days a week.  How many miles has she walked in 4 weeks?<n>Answer: 60<n><n>Input: A club is going to get additional members so that they will have 5 more than twice their current number of their members. If the club has 10 members now, how many additional members do they need?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>### Input:The wind tore off the shingles, what was the wind like? Choices:  A: dry hair B: spreading C: blowing hard D: change direction E: wave wheat<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### <n><n>1. How tall is he?<n>2. How much does he pay?<n>3. The king has as little money as all the people in his kingdom.<n><n>### 10. <n>7. How tall is he?<n>8.  How much does he owe?<n>9.  How tall does she stand?<n>10. Which number is greater?<n>
